description_html: Ashley is ready for her forever home! She'll be your little shadow and give you so many kisses any chance she gets. She's very social with other dogs, playful, and super snuggly. Ash is super smart and intuitive, we're sure she'll learn all the tricks/commands in no time. She already knows "sit" and is working on "shake". Please give this gentle girl a home!

name: Fritz
description_html:
Fritz is a happy-go-lucky guy who brings good vibes everywhere he goes. Easygoing, well-adjusted, and always smiling, he rolls with whatever the day brings‚Äîwalks, playtime, meeting new people‚Äîhe‚Äôs just happy to be included.


If you‚Äôre looking for a dog with a great personality and an even better attitude, Fritz is the kind of companion who makes life feel a little lighter and a lot more fun.

name: Milton
description_html:
Milton is a smart, happy, goofball! This charming brindle and white dog, with his irresistible smile and waggy tail, is joy personified. Milton's signature look often includes his tongue playfully flopped out, a testament to his lighthearted and enthusiastic spirit. He's a lover of all things fun ‚Äì a squeaky toy chase, a comfy couch for lounging, and especially, quality time with his favorite humans. 

Milton thrives on affection and is always ready to show off happy wiggles as he leans in for pets. He has a good mix of energy, always ready for a walk to do his business (he‚Äôs very housetrained), and to sniff around, as well as chill cuddle time. If you're seeking a loyal, affectionate, and utterly delightful companion to brighten your days, Milton is waiting to steal your heart. Meet him today!

name: Rutherford
description_html:
Rutherford is a happy-go-lucky pup who warms up to new people within minutes and who loves to show off his fun personality. He‚Äôs a mix of active and chill, and after getting out some energy, Rutherford is all about making a splash! He adores the water and loves cooling off in a kiddie pool.

But Rutherford isn't just a water dog; he's also a master of the zoomies! When that burst of energy hits, he transforms into a furry blur, racing around the yard with his tail wagging with joy. Rutherford's playful spirit and boundless enthusiasm are contagious, making him the perfect companion for anyone seeking a loyal, fun-loving friend who will shower his buddies with sweet kisses!

name: Choo Choo
description_html:
üöÇ All Aboard the Choo Choo Train! üöÇ This silly, sweet snuggle bug just rolled into the station and is patiently waiting for her forever family to hop aboard! Choo Choo arrived at the shelter as a puppy with her littermates and quietly watched as each of them found their new homes. Though she can be a little shy at first, it doesn't take long for her to warm up into a loving, affectionate cuddlebug.

This gentle girl has a delightfully goofy side. She loves chasing balls, splashing in puddles, and playing with other pups. Whether she's napping, playing, or chewing on a squeaky toy, Choo Choo is happiest when she's close to her people. Currently in foster care, Choo Choo is doing great with both a doggy sibling and a toddler, proving she's kid- and dog-friendly.

Her ideal forever home would be a quieter, low-traffic environment with:

  • A confident resident dog to help show her the ropes
  • Patient humans who will give her time to bloom
  • A yard to romp and play to her heart's content

Ready to welcome this sweet passenger into your life? Grab a ticket (ahem, submit an application) and hop on the Choo Choo train-next stop: forever!

name: Walrus
description_html: Walrus is a super cuddly sweetheart. His favorite things in life are walks and cuddles - he wants to sniff all the smells and get all the pets. The stress of shelter life is starting to wear on poor Walrus and he would love to find his forever home soon! Luckily he is very house trained and ready for his forever.

name: Walter
description_html:
Meet Walter!
Looking for the ultimate cuddle buddy? Walter is your guy! This sweet, gentle boy is the biggest lap dog you'll ever meet-he'll happily trade playtime for snuggles any day. Walter is a dream on the leash, making walks calm and easy, and he absolutely adores spending time with his volunteer friends.

With his loving nature and gentle heart, Walter is ready to bring joy and comfort to a forever home. He's the kind of dog who will always be by your side, whether you're out for a stroll or curled up on the couch.

Whoever gets to love Walter is going to be one very lucky person!

name: Emmitt
description_html:
Our boy Emmitt has loved going on adventures outside of the shelter, and it‚Äôs helping us learn more about this very good boy. Inside a home we found him to be so loving. He enjoys having a variety of toys to play with, but doing so right next to his people. He‚Äôs a multitasker who likes to play and snuggle at the same time. His signature move on a couch is to put his butt in the air and his head in your lap. This sweetheart is a bouncy ball of fun. At the shelter he loves going for walks, playing fetch in the play yards, or snuggling in the real life rooms.


Emmitt is also very house trained and knows a few tricks. He‚Äôs always up for a snack which make adding new tricks to his resume a breeze.


We‚Äôd love to see Emmitt in a home with daily walks, a bit of fetch, a full belly, and some extra snuggles.

name: Nagini
description_html:
Handsome Nagini found himself at AAC with a large number of other cats from the same home. He loves hanging out with his cat buddies, but isn't quite comfortable with humans. He is shy, and is usually found hanging out on the cat tower in his group room. If you slowly approach him, he doesn't run, but he is cautious. 

Nagini is not ready to accept being petted, but he will eat treats that are left nearby. He will be happiest in a quiet home with at least one cat buddy (one from his 'gang', or a new acquaintance). 

I am a DHC, and I have my own webpage: http://www.desperatehousecats.info/flyers/Nagini9081.pdf

The adoption fee is waived for Nagini and all Desperate Housecats!

name: Snape
description_html:
Snape came in with a large number of cats form the same home. He's shy, but he's learning! Snape may need a little guidance when he first arrives in a new place since he's been through so much change. This boy is affectionate and we don't think it will take long for him to build trust with the right person. He loves his cat friends so the ideal home will have a cat for him to befriend. 

I am a DHC, and I have my own webpage: http://www.desperatehousecats.info/flyers/Snape8946.pdf

The adoption fee is waived for Snape and all Desperate Housecats!

name: Rocky
description_html:
Meet Rocky


He's an adorable budding prince. You'll find him waiting by his kennel, with a smile and a tilted head as he so wants to connect to you and hopes you might stop and stay more than a couple seconds to meet him. He's very smart, a craft in the making, and he looks for guidance from his person. His VIP will help him finesse his leash skills, after all he's just a youngster still learning, with all the foundations of becoming a top dog for his people.

name: Chloe
description_html:
üêæ 

Meet Chloe ‚Äî The Sweet, Smart, and Snuggly Girl with a Big Heart!

Chloe is a gorgeous grey-and-white sweetheart who‚Äôs as smart as she is loving. She knows how to open doors (yes, really!) and is quick to pick up new commands. She loves to play fetch and proudly carries her ball around like it‚Äôs her prize possession. When it‚Äôs time to relax, she‚Äôs the ultimate cuddle bug, especially at night when she likes to be wrapped up and tucked under the covers right next to you.

At the dog park, Chloe is everyone‚Äôs best friend. She‚Äôs great with all dogs and loves to play, chase, and explore. She‚Äôs very social, gentle, and has a heart full of joy. Her favorite times of the day are mealtime, treat time, and of course, playtime!

When you come home, Chloe‚Äôs excitement is pure happiness, she‚Äôll greet you at the door with her whole body wiggling in joy. She also has a fun, athletic side: when she plays with her large soccer ball, she actually kicks it around using her front paws, she‚Äôs got some serious talent!

Chloe is the perfect mix of energy and affection. She loves adventure, but she also loves to snuggle in and watch a good movie with you. She‚Äôs loyal, loving, and always ready to make you smile.

If you‚Äôre looking for a smart, playful, affectionate companion who will fill your home with love and laughter, Chloe is the one.

name: Whitley
description_html:
Whitley is a sweet and adorable girl who is full of love and energy! She's friendly with everyone she meets and adores being close to her humans, cuddling up whenever she can.

She loves playing fetch, chasing toys, and showing off her incredible zoomies. A yard or an active adopter would be a dream for her. She also has the potential to share her forever home with a dog sibling.

Whitley was being cared for by our medical team for the beginning of her stay with us, so we think this petite lady was just overlooked! But now she's happy, healthy, and ready to start her life and leave her kennel behind.

If you have any questions, please reach out to orangedotcrew@gmail.com to kickstart this heartwarming journey. For more delightful updates, follow Orange Dot Crew on Facebook and Instagram.

name: Berlin
description_html:
Berlin is the kind of dog who could have stepped out of an animated film. Big-hearted, pleasantly goofy and always ready to brighten a room. His expressions have a storytelling quality to them, as if he‚Äôs narrating his own adventures in real time.


He walks on a leash with the ease of a seasoned gentleman, is house-trained and has a calm, friendly presence around both dogs and cats. Volunteers adore him and often linger at his kennel just a bit longer than planned because he is simply that fun to be around.


Berlin would transition beautifully into a home or apartment. He is adaptable, lovable and seems to have a talent for making people feel like they‚Äôve known him forever. If you‚Äôve been hoping for a companion with a hint of cartoon charm and a whole lot of warmth, he may be your perfect match.


He is dog and cat friendly.

name: Paxton
description_html:
We learned of some sadness from Paxton's former life. When he arrived in June his feet had been taped up. Staff removed the tapes and he walked gingerly for a few days while his paws were treated. We don't know why the tapes were there. Every day since he's been his friendly happy self at his kennel gate, waiting for visitors in an expansive kennel but the constant standing and wagging of his tail right behind his door, close to a side wall, has led to a bit of a happy tail. It's been getting battered more and more. Now he's been neutered so he can have dog meet ups. Now we think he's ready for a friend for the first time. But more findings came from his neuter: "Rads show old possible left femoral neck fracture and definite hip dysplasia left side now. Also has severe lumbo-sacral spondylosis.

With this news, we know how urgent our efforts need to be be find home comforts for our friend Pax.

We believed he was about 8 yrs old but he is wearing so much more trauma and aging on his body. In spite of it all, he still loves to be active, roll in the grass and play with toys.

Are you ready to make a difference in the life of a dog that desperately needs to have some time living a normal dogs life for a change? Can you give our Paxton a chance to experience life as it was meant to be?

His advocates at caring@classiccanines.org offer special support for adopters of dogs 7 and up, and he is also available for foster. Check in with staff or at caring@classiccanines.org

name: Mr. Muffin
description_html:
Meet Mr. Muffin ‚Äî the strong, silent type with a heart of gold. This independent and loving boy is house trained, easygoing, and carries himself with quiet confidence. Once you earn his trust, his playful, gentle side shines through ‚Äî especially when he‚Äôs getting pampered with chest scratches, temple massages, or a good brushing (his absolute favorite!).

Volunteers can‚Äôt help but fall for Mr. Muffin‚Äôs calm, soulful presence ‚Äî he‚Äôs the kind of dog that makes you wish your home could fit ‚Äújust one more.‚Äù On park outings, he takes everything in stride, relaxed and well-mannered amid all the activity. Mr. Muffin is also treat-motivated and proudly shows off his ‚Äúsit‚Äù on command.

If you‚Äôre looking for a steady, affectionate companion who brings peace, loyalty, and quiet joy, Muffin might just be your perfect match.

name: Barry
description_html:
Barry is a lively, curious adventurer who‚Äôs always ready to go! Easy to harness, but once that leash is clipped, he‚Äôs off with enthusiasm‚Äîsometimes pulling, sometimes zig-zagging, and often crossing in front like he‚Äôs leading you on his own special tour.


In our real-life room, Barry showed us just how inquisitive he is: grabbing enrichment puzzles off the shelf, spelunking under couch covers, and even helping himself to a few milk bones. He‚Äôs a bundle of energy who loves exploring every nook and cranny.


But don‚Äôt let his playful antics fool you‚ÄîBarry has a sweet, affectionate side. Once he‚Äôs had his fun, he‚Äôs more than happy to settle in next to you for pets and cuddles. He thrives on attention and companionship, making him a wonderful match for someone who enjoys both adventure and downtime.

Barry would love:


An active home where he can run, play, and explore

A family ready to guide his energy with patience and consistency

Plenty of enrichment toys and puzzles to keep his clever mind busy

A comfy spot next to you when it‚Äôs time to relax

Barry is ready to bring joy, laughter, and love into his forever home. Could that be with you?

name: Spud
description_html: Spud is a super cute young dog with wrinkles and a curly tail who looks like a Sharpei mixed with a large furry breed. He is a happy, friendly boy who loves to romp around the playyard, tossing around squeaky toys and chasing balls. Spud also entertains himself by jumping in the doggie pool and splashing around in the water. He is especially fun to watch enjoying playtime in the yard. Spud is sweet and affectionate and gently takes treats. He will make a great companion for an active person who enjoys quality time with a young, playful dog.

name: Boogie
description_html:
Meet Boogie! üíô

Say hello to Boogie, the cutest little pittie short stack you‚Äôll ever meet! This pint-sized sweetheart is all about love, snuggles, and living life with a happy heart. Boogie may be small, but his personality is huge ‚Äî he‚Äôs got the perfect mix of mellow and playful.

Boogie is a dream on leash and loves going for walks, exploring the world at an easy pace by your side. When you‚Äôre busy, he‚Äôs perfectly content entertaining himself with a toy or a cozy nap. He‚Äôs also shown great manners with other dogs ‚Äî he‚Äôs a polite ‚Äúcoexistor‚Äù who enjoys hanging out without any fuss. And bonus points: Boogie has met a cat and passed his test with flying colors! üê±

If you‚Äôre looking for a cuddly, easygoing companion who will fill your days with warmth and your couch with snuggles, Boogie is your guy. Come meet this lovable shorty ‚Äî he‚Äôs ready to wiggle his way into your heart forever! üíû

If you have any questions, please reach out to orangedotcrew@gmail.com to kickstart this heartwarming journey. For more delightful updates, follow Orange Dot Crew on Facebook and Instagram.

name: Sassy
description_html:
Sassy is a pup who can fit into so many types of homes, and it's truly a mystery why she's been at the shelter as long as she has. She's housetrained, social with other dogs, and such a polite, independent girl. Sassy girl walks nicely on her leash and knows "sit" and "paw." She is very treat motivated and super smart, so it would be pretty easy to train her to do so many fun tricks.


Sassy is a pretty easy going dog who loves puzzle toys and eating tasty things. She might tell you she wants another treat with a "sasy" bark, but we don't imagine she'll be a super loud girl at home. It's just that she knows she's a queen who deserves a soft bed and lots of tasty snacks with a family who loves her.

name: Akita
description_html:
Looking for a ride along, take along, be a dog good friend and a good people friend type companion? You'll landed on the right lady. She has all the wisdom and she's healthy, a great weight, heart worm negative, vaccinated, spayed and ready for all her tomorrows. She's very friendly and loves when you talk to her. Did you know that mature dogs have a great grasp of language? Find out how life can be a breeze with a mature lady like Akita in your household by clicking on her link to start the conversation with her fosters.

She's advocated by her fosters and her volunteer advocates at ClassicCaninesATX.

We aim to make transitioning a mature shelter pet (7 yrs and up) home a breeze by offering supplies through an eGift card through Chewy, paired with a veterinary care credit at an owners choice of clinic.

name: Bourdain
description_html:
Bourdain has already survived a lot. Found on limping on the side of the road, x-rays revealed bullet fragments in his leg and chest, but you‚Äôd never know it from how joyfully he lives each day.

He‚Äôs playful, silly, and full of personality. In the play yard, Bourdain turns fetch into an art form ‚Äî sometimes carrying two toys at once, just because he can (he's a big boy at 76 pounds). Volunteers call him ‚Äúridiculously cute‚Äù and say he‚Äôs happiest leaning in for scratches between rounds of play.

Bourdain can get a little over-excited sometimes, so he‚Äôll need an adult-only home with a patient adopter who can give him some structure. He will need a meet and greet with any resident pups, but his playful, curious side really shines through once he feels secure.

If you have any questions, please reach out to orangedotcrew@gmail.com to kickstart this heartwarming journey. For more delightful updates, follow Orange Dot Crew on Facebook and Instagram.

name: Pumba
description_html: Pumba is the rambunctious one of the pair, always chatty, active and the first to initiate playtime. The only thing he loves more than zooming around and napping is his brother who is sometimes not quite in the mood at first. Pumba enjoys taking a close look at whatever is going on around him whether that be your phone or anything else you've got he's just gotta know. Once he's tuckered out he curls right up with his brother and snoozes until he's recharged.

name: Timon
description_html: Timon, despite being the skinnier brother, is a calm cool cat, he likes to perch up high and observe from afar but also still loves to play with toys or his brother when the mood (or his brother) strikes. A genuine sight-seer who can nap in any spot and any posture. He's quite fond of anything he is able to move himself whether it be for comfort or entertainment. He loves his brother almost as much as wet food and both can help him get a cozy good night's sleep.

name: Marshall
description_html:
Marshall is that perfect mix of mellow and merry. He loves walks where he can take his time sniffing everything, gentle play sessions in the yard, and splashing his paws in the pool before curling up for cuddles.

In playgroup, Marshall is the social type ‚Äî greeting other dogs with a wag and sometimes getting a little too enthusiastic. He‚Äôs easy to redirect, and his goofy charm always wins everyone back over. Volunteers say he‚Äôs a ‚Äúsweet boy who just wants to be part of the fun.‚Äù

This handsome senior is housetrained, affectionate, and ready to trade the noisy kennels for a quiet home and comfy couch.

name: Doobie Dab
description_html:
Meet Doobie!

Doobie is a sweet, sensitive cuddle bug who just wants to be close to his person. He‚Äôs a dream on the leash and loves going for relaxed walks around the neighborhood. He's silly and goofy, and loves toys! Doobie already knows several commands ‚Äî ‚Äúsit,‚Äù ‚Äúlay down,‚Äù and even ‚Äúnight-night‚Äù ‚Äî and he sleeps soundly through the night on his bed.

This smart boy is crate-trained, house-trained, and friendly with other large dogs. He does best with calm, lower-energy pups (too much excitement can overwhelm him), but he enjoys the company of other gentle dogs. Above all, Doobie is a loyal ‚ÄúVelcro dog‚Äù who loves being by your side and will quickly become your shadow and best friend.

name: Angel
description_html: Meet Angel - your future adventure buddy with a heart of gold! Angel is a smart, loyal girl who picks up new things quickly and keeps us smiling with her charming personality. She's housetrained, crate trained, and does well being left alone for a few hours. Like many young dogs, she still has some puppy behaviors-like mouthiness-that she's working on. She's also making great progress with leash reactivity through training and already showing improvement. Angel would thrive in a home with a fenced yard where she can run and play. While she could do well in a family setting, she tends to bond closely with one person and would be an amazing, loyal companion for someone looking for a smart, active partner.

name: Alfie
description_html:
Looking for a loyal companion with a coat as unique as his personality? Say hello to Alfie! This handsome boy sports a truly striking orange brindle pattern that sets him apart from the pack.

Alfie is a well-mannered gentleman. He‚Äôs housetrained and a pleasure for brisk walks. If there‚Äôs one thing Alfie loves almost as much as his humans, it‚Äôs food and treats‚Äîmaking training sessions a breeze! This playful and active boy thrives on an active lifestyle and Alfie is always ready for fun. His loving, energetic nature makes him an ideal addition to a home ready for adventure and endless snuggles. Come meet Alfie and fall in love!

name: Xena
description_html:
Get to know Xena......... a loving brindle babe!

Xena is very smart and quick learner with the help of treats. She knows sit, shake, down, and kisses. Treats and food are big motivators and help to distract her when necessary. She is low to medium energy. She does not bark a lot outside the shelter.

Spending time with Xena outside - She casually strolls on a leash but does get excited when she sees squirrels and lizards. She doesn't seem bothered passing people or other dogs at a distance. She understands "Let's go and This Way" if she gets fixated on things. Expect to see some zoomies in a backyard. She likes to chase soccer balls. She is also happy to sit outside with her human and people watch.

Spending time with Xena inside - She is house trained. She will self-entertain with toys of all kinds, not a picky girl. Give her a smoked beef bone with marrow and she is the happiest dog. Loves, loves, loves belly rubs!!! She is at ease when grooming (bath, nails, and ears).

Xena in the car - She loves car rides and is an excellent passenger. She does not jump over seats in an SUV. She will alternate looking out the window and laying down.

Xena is a great catch! Check her out!

name: Yeti
description_html:
Looking for a calm, cuddly companion? Yeti is your guy! This sweet, gentle, and mellow pup has been at the shelter since July, patiently waiting for his perfect match.

Yeti is very house trained, leash trained, and has the perfect medium energy‚Äîalways ready for a walk, then a nap and some cuddles. He loves food and treats and enjoys the company of other chill dogs.

Oh, and he‚Äôs kind of a star‚ÄîYeti made a TV appearance on FOX 7, charming everyone he met!

See the segment here: https://www.fox7austin.com/video/1087057

If you‚Äôre looking for a laid-back, loving best friend, Yeti‚Äôs your match. Come meet this handsome boy today and see why everyone‚Äôs falling for him!

name: Salchicha
description_html: Salchicha is 45 lbs of love and fun. She is well-mannered on leash, and playful and cuddly when she's let loose. She loves water and cooling off in the kiddie pool. Salchicha is medium energy and has potential live with another well-matched dog.

name: Mango
description_html: Sweet Mango is a little shy with new people but warms up quickly with her friends. She is very house trained, walks easily on leash, and enjoys exploring the grounds Mango is dog social, has had a kennelmate and joined doggie playgroup. Mango is comfortable in the home setting of the real life room, snuggling on the couch and appreciating pets and cuddles. She sits for treats and gently takes them. Pretty Mango is a mellow, affectionate young dog who will make a wonderful companion in a loving home, given adequate time to decompress and feel safe in a new environment.

name: Beef
description_html:
Beef is a handsome young pup with cute puppy eyes that show all the love he has to give! Beef loves fun and games; he lives for fetch and a good romp with any ball!

Beef isn't just a playful goofball; he also shows his true gentlemanly side. He's already housetrained and walks like a pro, making him great on a leash. Plus, he's shown to be dog-friendly and done well in playgroups. 

Ready for a devoted, ball-loving companion to bring some joy to your life? Beef is ready for his forever home!

name: Biggie
description_html: Biggie is a big baby looking for someone to show him that the world isn't such a scary place! This guy is housetrained and has previous experience living with dogs. The shelter is a very scary place for him - can you offer him a quiet oasis?

name: Regina
description_html:
Meet Regina George ‚Äì the low-riding, high-spirited queen of sass! üëëüêæ

Regina may still be a puppy learning her manners, but what she lacks in polish, she more than makes up for in personality. This short-stacked, spunky girl is full of charm, mischief, and belly laughs‚Äîshe‚Äôll have you smiling from the moment you meet her.

She‚Äôs sassy in all the best ways, loves to play with toys, and is a world-class splooter. Regina absolutely soaks up love and attention, and once she settles into a home, she shows she really knows how to chill. She's had a few boyfriends at the shelter (what can we say‚Äîshe's a heartbreaker), but what she really wants is a forever family to call her own.

Whether she's making you laugh with her antics or melting into a cuddle puddle, Regina is pure joy in a low-riding package.

Come meet this hilarious, affectionate, and totally unforgettable girl‚ÄîRegina George is ready to rule your heart! üíñüëë

If you have any questions, please reach out to orangedotcrew@gmail.com to kickstart this heartwarming journey. For more delightful updates, follow Orange Dot Crew on Facebook and Instagram.

name: Ellie
description_html:
Sweet, silly, and affectionate, Ellie is the most beautiful golden girl looking for a soft place to land and a family to call her own. On the labrador retriever color spectrum, one might say she lands somewhere between "lightly toasted" and "golden." She has the most adorable ears (one that sticks up and the other that flops over) and the cutest docked tail. She is currently housed with an older, mellow dog and a younger, active dog. She is a fantastic dog friend because she knows how to match the energy and respect the boundaries of anyone she plays with. Ellie is house-trained, a loose-leash walker, quiet (not a big barker from what her foster parents can tell), doesn't get on furniture unless invited, is non-destructive when left alone in the home, and sleeps well throughout the night. When out and about she has met babies, toddlers, teens, and seniors, and has done well with everyone. Her favorite things include walks, napping, car rides, playing, and belly rubs! If you decide to stop petting her, be prepared for her to politely ask for "more pets, please!" Ellie is not a fan of rabbits, cats, closed doors in confining spaces, loud sudden noises, or flags flapping in the breeze.


Because not a whole lot is known about her past, Ellie can still be shy in new situations and around people she doesn't know. In these situations, usually a high-value treat and a little patience goes a long way to winning her over. Ellie would thrive in a home where she can demand all the belly rubs her heart desires, and a cozy place to curl up.


Click "Get Started" to connect with this beautiful pup in person!

name: Frankie Paul Wall
description_html:
This handsome fella may be shy at first, but there is a sweet and curious heart behind those eyes! Frankie is still learning to trust people, and while new situations can make him nervous, he can't resist coming up to the fence to quietly say hello.


We think Frankie Paul Wall may not have had a whole lot of human interaction before coming here, but he is one of those why pups who is trying their absolute hardest to break out of their shell! He now play-bows his friends while in kennel when they come up to say hi or take him on a walk. He has started asking for pets and giving kisses to the people he loves.


He is non-destructive and has started to house train himself over the last few weeks! He is extremely quiet, gentle, low energy, and sweet natured.

name: Sam Winchester
description_html: Sam & Dean Winchester are best buds and they need to be adopted together! These boys are precious as a pair. When walking together they lean into each other and lick each other's faces. They rely on each other for comfort and security. Sam & Dean may get excited in the kennel, but they calm down once out and do their business like champs. They are easy to walk on leash, so don't be shy about taking these boys out. Sam & Dean are ready to meet their new family today!

name: Mae
description_html: Meet Mae! She's a friendly girl who loves a game of fetch. Mae is very friendly once she gets to know you and will climb in your lap for cuddles and pets. 46 pounds isn't too big to be a lap dog, right? We don't think so! Mae gets along well with her current room mate at the shelter, too. She goes potty like a champ outside. What more can you ask for? Adopt Mae today!

name: Noah
description_html:
Noah is a sunshine-colored yellow Lab mix with a heart just as bright. This very good boy is incredibly house-trained, affectionate, and highly treat-motivated, making him a fantastic candidate for continued training and learning new skills. He‚Äôs the kind of dog who truly wants to please and will happily work for a tasty reward.


Noah gets along well with both dogs and cats, showing a calm, friendly nature around other animals. On walks, he can be a strong puller when an interesting scent catches his attention, but the great news is that training vouchers are available to help his future family work on leash manners and build even better walking skills together.


He is exceptionally sweet, takes treats gently, and loves nothing more than being close to his people. With his loving personality and solid manners at home, Noah would be a wonderful addition to just about any household. He‚Äôs ready to share his loyalty, cuddles, and happy spirit with a family of his own.

name: Dean Winchester
description_html: Sam & Dean Winchester are best buds and they need to be adopted together! These boys are precious as a pair. When walking together they lean into each other and lick each other's faces. They rely on each other for comfort and security. Sam & Dean may get excited in the kennel, but they calm down once out and do their business like champs. They are easy to walk on leash, so don't be shy about taking these boys out. Sam & Dean are ready to meet their new family today!

name: Shamu
description_html: Poblano has been through some tough times and he's not the happiest camper at the shelter. He's lived with other cats before but doesn't seem to enjoy their company, so he would do much better on his own. Poblano can be a hidey cat when he's not feeling brave. He may prefer a calmer home with a cat savvy person to set him up for success. He's not a great fit for small children or dogs. This poor guy could use a place to decompress and get his kitty life back on track!

name: Sosa
description_html: Per Sosa's foster: Sweet Sosa is about 10 years old and has some special needs. Sosa is blind but can see shadows in one of his eyes and has hearing loss. Sosa can hear and follow me via by calling his name, clapped hands, and whistles. Sosa can independently walk inside and outside of my house but will occasionally bump a few times around furniture. However, my 8 year old dog guides and plays with Sosa throughout the day. Sosa loves to play with squeaky toys and balls, rolling over the grass, cuddles, belly rubs, and walking in a neighborhood park on a leash. If you're interested in meeting Sosa, please reach out!

name: Jojo
description_html: Jojo is a somewhat shy boy (especially with new people), but he doesn't let that stop him from enjoying walks with friends. He walks very well on leash and is easy to direct. His favorite snack might be cat treats. Maybe because of his tiger stripes? Jojo spent a short time in a home with children and enjoyed their company. He may need slow introductions with other dogs until he is feeling confident in a new home. Jojo is well mannered and mellow, a gentle boy who is ready for his home!

name: Jr
description_html:
JR has come a long way since first arriving at the shelter ‚Äî from a shy, shut-down pup to a gentle, curious companion who‚Äôs learning that people can be pretty great.


This shy guy prefers quiet moments, and he‚Äôs been making steady progress with patient volunteers. Now, he happily comes forward for walks, enjoys slow laps around the yard, and even offers sweet ‚Äúnose boops‚Äù to his favorite humans in exchange for treats.


JR seems house-trained, food-motivated, and does best when the world moves at his pace. He‚Äôs looking for a calm home with understanding people who will give him time to settle in and continue blossoming into a loving dog.

name: Franco
description_html: üêæ Meet Mr. Franco - Your Gentle Giant in Training! üêæ Looking for an adolescent pup who's already house, potty, and crate trained? Good with dog-savvy kids? Happy to chill by your side while you work or watch TV? Full of personality and gets along with other dogs? Then Mr. Franco might just be your unicorn! At around 7 months old and already tipping the scales at over 50 pounds, Franco is a big-hearted goofball who doesn't quite realize his own size. He's the perfect mix of cuddly and calm, with bursts of excited energy when it's time to play, especially with people, pups, or when there's food involved. Franco is currently in foster care, where he's working hard on his recall, patience, and manners. Like many tall boys, he's been known to counter-surf, but his foster mom assures us: "We're working on it!" Hand him a toy or a bone, and Franco's in heaven. üè° Ideal Home: Franco will thrive in a home that can offer him a balance of activity and downtime-think daily walks or dog park play, followed by some solid couch cuddles. Due to his size and puppy energy, we recommend a home without cats and without very young children, unless they're experienced with dogs.

name: Diamond
description_html: Diamond has a lot of personality filled with wiggles and cuddles! She seems to really enjoy hanging out with her people. She may jump at first greetings because she gets excited, but she calms down once she is out and about on leash. Diamond's favorite things are balls and chew toys! She can keep herself entertained for awhile. She's a snuggler, so expect this girl to keep you company when you need it the most.

name: Mr Kitten
description_html:
Built like a tank but with a heart as squishy as a land manatee, this big blockhead is basically a canine Travis Kelce: charming, incredibly good looking, and impossible not to love.

Mr. Kitten has excellent leash manners and is wonderfully patient with newer volunteers‚Äîhe‚Äôll let beginners practice harnessing without a fuss. He‚Äôs calm and collected walking past kennels or other dogs, taking everything in stride with his signature mellow confidence.

Under that handsome gray coat is the sweetest heart you‚Äôll ever meet. Don‚Äôt let his size fool you: he‚Äôs a gentle giant through and through. On the leash, he‚Äôs a loose-leash pro; off the leash, he becomes the world‚Äôs cuddliest couch companion with plenty of surface area for snuggles.

Kind, loving, and endlessly mellow, Mr. Kitten is the dog who wins people over instantly. Come meet him‚Äîyour only regret will be not doing it sooner.

name: Jelly
description_html:
A gentle, shy girl with a heart full of love just waiting to bloom, Jelly is a calm, observant pup who feels most at ease in a quiet, low-traffic home without kids - the perfect match for a homebody who enjoys cozy nights in and the occasional walk or adventure. She is house-trained, making her an easy addition to your home.

Jelly finds comfort and confidence around other dogs. She loves playing and cuddling with her foster roommate and would thrive in a home with a friendly canine companion.

When her humans are relaxing, Jelly is right there beside them - peaceful and content. She may take some time to earn your trust, but once she does, she‚Äôll be your loyal little shadow. Her herding instincts make her an attentive, quick learner who would love puzzle toys, enrichment activities, or fun training sessions.

Jelly enjoys running in the backyard and walks beautifully on a leash, calmly minding her own business around other dogs and people. She‚Äôs also polite with cats - she simply lets them be.

She‚Äôs still learning that chews are hers to enjoy, and her sweet, cautious nature makes every new discovery a joy to witness.

If you‚Äôre looking for a gentle soul to share your quiet moments and daily routines, Jelly is ready to melt into your heart and your home.

name: Horchata
description_html:
Horchata may look like a little nugget with short, stubby legs, but don‚Äôt be fooled‚Äîthis boy is a rocket! He‚Äôs easy to leash and cooperative when putting on his harness, but once you step outside, he‚Äôs ready to go.


Watching Horchata run is pure comedy gold. You‚Äôd think those little legs would slow him down, but he can move‚Äîand he‚Äôll keep going long after you‚Äôre ready to stop. In fact, you‚Äôll probably tire out before he does!


Beyond his hilarious zoomies, Horchata is a sweet companion who loves being out of his kennel and exploring the world. His joyful energy and goofy charm make him a one-of-a-kind pup who‚Äôs guaranteed to bring laughter and love into his forever home.


Horchata would love:


A family who enjoys playtime and outdoor adventures

Space to run and show off his speedy little legs

Plenty of affection and attention when it‚Äôs time to settle down

Horchata is ready to rocket his way into your heart‚Äîcome meet him today!

name: Gina
description_html:
Meet Gina


Gina's marble-gray eyes show you her spark for life and how much she wants to please you! She enjoys all the good things in life and has social circles that extend to all people she meets and her dog friends like Ivan who's she's kenneled with. She loves cuddles, pets, treats (great for training and agility fun). She loves good sniffs and rolling in the grass. She has a wonderful energy to keep up with all the fun things you want to do and then settle down for all the affections. Looking for an activity partner? Come meet this keeper!

name: Cornelia
description_html: Cornelia is a little shy with new people but a total goofball once she lets loose. At 1 year old she is still bursting with puppy energy - she loves toys, fetch, and would splash around in some water and run around all day if you'd let her! Looking for a high-energy side-kick to all your adventures? Cornelia is your gal!

name: Matildo
description_html:
Matildo is an 11-year-old sweetheart who was found near East 16th Street near Airport Blvd. We mention this in case someone is missing this older guy. 
For about a month, Matildo was once Matilda- until it was discovered he was actually just a tiny boy when he came in to get spayed!

This chatty guy loves attention, especially scritches under his ear and he'll nuzzle his face into your hand to ask for more. One of his cutest quirks is the way he curls his tail like a little chameleon. He is highly motivated by Churu treats and wet food. Matildo is a low-energy, mellow companion who enjoys lounging and taking long naps with the occasional playtime break.

He's the perfect match for someone looking for a calm, affectionate cat who just wants to be close and soak up love. If you're ready to give a gentle, talkative kitty his forever home, Matildo is waiting to meet you!

name: Grace
description_html:
Grace is SO sweet! She is calm, loving and has never met a stranger. At the shelter, she is often used as the first dog a new volunteer walks because she is so gentle and easy.


She walks beautifully on the leash and does not react to any dogs, squirrels or birds that pass by. She will request pets to anyone she meets, and if they have some treats, she will take them very gently.


At home, Grace loves cuddling and is the perfect Netflix companion.

She is also very house trained, so she is perfect for house or apartment life.


Come meet her today and fall in love with this perfect lady ü•∞

name: Nayla
description_html:
Nayla is one special girl who will absolutely steal your heart from the very first hello. She‚Äôs friendly, fun, and full of affection, always ready for a splash in the pool or a good game of fetch. But don‚Äôt let her playful side fool you‚Äîshe also knows how to slow down and get super cozy, especially when she‚Äôs wrapped up in her favorite blankets, just soaking up all the love from her people.


This sweetheart is house-trained and walks beautifully on a leash, making her an easy companion for both busy days and relaxed evenings. Nayla‚Äôs the perfect size for cuddles, adventures, and everything in between.


Her beautiful salt-and-pepper face gives her an undeniable old soul charm, and you can tell she‚Äôs patiently waiting to find her forever family‚Äîthe perfect match who will cherish her just as much as she will them.


If you‚Äôre searching for a loyal, loving companion who thrives on connection and cuddles, Nayla might just be the one to fill your life with joy and warmth.

name: Bandit
description_html:
Hi! My name is Bandit, though the volunteers keep calling me cutie instead.


i just came off of age lock a few weeks ago which means I get to finally explore outside my kennel! Happy 5 month birthday present to me!


I have found a love for the kiddie pools in the play yards, cuddling up for pets, and running around with soft doggie friends! I‚Äôm still learning the leash but am picking it up like a pro.


Since I haven‚Äôt met too many people yet I‚Äôm a little shy for the first minute, but after that I will want all the attention, loving, and playing you are willing to give!

name: Nellie
description_html:
Nellie is a former community cat who was brought to AAC with her young kittens. She is friendly and can easily be handled, even when she was caring for her babies.


Nellie is a little shy and doesn‚Äôt like the noises of the shelter, so a quiet home is going to be best for her. Once she warms to you, she enjoys being petted. She might be a lap cat, and she is playful.


Nellie may get along with other cats given slow introductions. 


I am a DHC, and I have my own webpage!


The adoption fee is waived for Nellie and all Desperate Housecats!

name: Jack
description_html:
Say hello to Jack! This striking, chocolate-colored pup is a delightful mix of playful and calm energy. Jack is a smart cookie who absolutely loves food and treats! He's always up for a good walk and romp in the yard, but he's also happy to settle down for a relaxing afternoon. He is an affectionate guy who loves to give and receive affection.  

With his beautiful amber eyes and friendly demeanor, Jack is ready to bring his loving, well-mannered self into your heart and home.

name: Kaiser
description_html:
Kaiser has strikingly handsome looks, fitting of his noble name, but deep down, he‚Äôs just an easygoing floof. He‚Äôs very housetrained, a good walking partner, loves treats, and would be a great companion for any big dog lover.

Kaiser‚Äôs been learning to play fetch and getting quite good at it. He‚Äôs a unique German Shepherd who is pretty laid back and could fit into many different lifestyles. Come meet him and see if he‚Äôs the one!

name: Cyber
description_html:
Cyber is a dog volunteers loving refer to as a ‚Äúpre-programmed puppy‚Äù. She‚Äôs leash trained and loves to give nose boops while walking. In the car she hops right in and is calm and quiet. She knows sit, down, and roll over and would love to add to her resume if it means getting more treats.

Cyber is that sweet spot of great at self entertaining (give her allll the stuffies) but also likes to have fun playing fetch with her human pals. She loves kiddie pools but feels meh about pools.

Our little lady is also very cuddly! Belly rubs, rubbing against your leg like a cat, or asking for back scratches, she‚Äôs here for it all.

Did you know she also loves to show off her tricks? "Sit", "Shake", "Down", and "Roll Over" - She has mastered them all!

She‚Äôs a puppy her friends refuse to let grow up in the shelter. She‚Äôs been going on some field trips with her friends and having a blast. Come meet this little lady- and bring treats!

name: Inkie
description_html:
She's full of energy and enjoys playing "fetch" with her favorite toy. She'll cuddle on your lap for her afternoon cat nap. A great biscuit maker, too. Watching birds and squirrels keeps her entertained. She's sweet, precious loving and quickly steals your heart.

She's been an only fur baby in a quiet home, so we don't know how she'd do with other cats, dogs, or children. 

She needs to be an indoor only kitty because of her eye.

name: Tea
description_html:
Yerba and Tea came in as silly little stray scaredy kittens. They are on a journey of self-reflection. Their goal is to be braver with people! Yerba and Tea enjoy play time with wand toys, and though they may take some time to warm up to new people, we think they will reach their goal sooner than later. They may do best in a calm home with a cat friend to learn from and a patient adopter to help them on their journey.


Yerba and Tea are now a part of our Cactus Cat program for shy cats who need a little help from volunteers. They don't have to go home together, but do enjoy each other's company.


I am a DHC, and I have my own webpage!


The adoption fee is waived for Tea and all Cactus Cats/Desperate Housecats!

name: Yerba
description_html:
Yerba and Tea came in as silly little stray scaredy kittens. They are on a journey of self-reflection. Their goal is to be braver with people! Yerba and Tea enjoy play time with wand toys, and though they may take some time to warm up to new people, we think they will reach their goal sooner than later. They may do best in a calm home with a cat friend to learn from and a patient adopter to help them on their journey. Yerba and Tea are now a part of our Cactus Cat program for shy cats who need a little help from volunteers. They don't have to go home together, but do enjoy each other's company.


I am a DHC, and I have my own webpage!


The adoption fee is waived for Yerba and all Cactus Cats/Desperate Housecats!

name: Koda
description_html: Koda was brought to us when her owner could no longer care for her. In her previous home, she was friendly with people and children. She's also a smarty pants and learned several commands: sit, stay, come, shake/paw, and leave it. Her favorite activity is going on walks! At the shelter, she has also enjoyed lounging in the pool during the hot summer days. When she greets you, she may jump because she's just so excited to say "hello", but she's working on that! Koda is ready to leave kennel life behind and get to her home today.

name: Baloo
description_html:
Baloo (13453) has been at the shelter for over 100 days, and in that time, we‚Äôve watched him slowly rebuild trust and show who he really is: a deeply affectionate, toy-loving, belly-rub champion who lights up the moment he‚Äôs with someone he knows.


At the shelter, Baloo is mostly a loose-leash walker, easy to harness with a lick mat, and always excited to grab a toy for his walk ‚Äî even if he drops it 10 seconds later. He adores the play yard, especially chasing balls and trotting them back with a proud little wiggle. Volunteers call him ‚Äúso loving and lovable,‚Äù and once he feels safe, he leans his whole body into you for affection.


Baloo is still a sensitive dog who‚Äôs learning that people can be kind, and he sometimes needs a moment to warm up to new faces. But the second he realizes you‚Äôre his person, he becomes all heart ‚Äî playful, cuddly, and eager to be close.


He‚Äôs housetrained, he‚Äôs smart, and he‚Äôs come so far. What he needs now is a home that will give him consistency, patience, and love ‚Äî things he‚Äôs more than ready to give back.

name: Wanda
description_html:
Wanda came in shy but she's really blossomed here! She was brought to us when her owner could no longer care for her. She loves pets but she's a bit of a wallflower. She won't shout out to you that she wants pets, but she loves attention and affection. 

Wanda used to live with small dogs and she's gotten along well with cats in her room at the shelter. She's a mild mannered young lady who has adapted to so much change with a pawsitive attitude.

I am a DHC, and I have my own webpage: http://www.desperatehousecats.info/flyers/Wanda13688.pdf

The adoption fee is waived for Wanda and all Desperate Housecats!

name: Hank
description_html: Hank is such a lovable guy! He's full of energy and loves zooming around the backyard, playing tug of war, and keep away games. But he also knows how to kick back and relax-whether he's lounging on the floor or curled up in his cozy bed. Hank's pretty smart too-he can sit, lie down, roll over, and shake. He's still learning how to walk nicely on a leash, but he's eager to improve. Overall, Hank's a sweet goofball who just needs a wonderful home to share his love!

name: Gus
description_html:
Gus' foster says: "Gus is a sweet, young, chill, and friendly boy. He is good on walks and totally crate trained. He is in obedience training now and doing great! Sit, stay, leave it, etc.

He is good with dogs ‚Äì my older pups tell him off occasionally for being rambunctious, and he takes it in stride and gives them some space. He is a lovable, funloving guy and is even learning to get along with my cat."

name: Teddy
description_html:
Teddy and Rosie came in together as shy kittens in need of some socialization and TLC. They have excelled at nose-boops training (put your finger up to them to meet and when they boop your finger, offer a treat). They also love Churu for their reward. They will purr and cuddle up to their human friends once they get to know you. These two seem bonded and should go home together as they are a comfort to each other. Teddy and Rosie will need a patient, cat-savvy adopter willing to give them time and space to blossom in a quiet home. They may always be on the timid side, but we think they can be very loyal and loving companions in the right home.

The fee is waived for these babies and all Cactus Cats!

name: Rosie
description_html:
Teddy and Rosie came in together as shy kittens in need of some socialization and TLC. They have excelled at nose-boops training (put your finger up to them to meet and when they boop your finger, offer a treat). They also love Churu for their reward. They will purr and cuddle up to their human friends once they get to know you. These two seem bonded and should go home together as they are a comfort to each other. Teddy and Rosie will need a patient, cat-savvy adopter willing to give them time and space to blossom in a quiet home. They may always be on the timid side, but we think they can be very loyal and loving companions in the right home.

The fee is waived for these babies and all Cactus Cats!

name: Meatball
description_html:
His name may be Meatball, but this guy is actually a total ham! This sweet, snuggly boy is famous for his full-body cuddles and big goofy grin.

Don‚Äôt let his laid-back charm fool you. Meatball isn‚Äôt just lazy! He‚Äôs playful, loves zooming around the yard, and then happily settles in for some serious snuggle time. He‚Äôs a mostly loose-leash walker and an extremely house-trained gentleman who knows how to keep things neat and tidy.

With his mix of sweetness, silliness, and perfectly portioned energy, Meatball is the ultimate comfort companion. Come meet him and see why everyone falls in love with this lovable ham!

name: Pixie
description_html: Pixie arrived at the shelter due to a family emergency. In his previous home, he enjoyed access to a catio where he could lounge in the safety of the outdoors. Pixie has lived with small dogs and other cats. He's a friendly boy that can sometimes get overly excited and may give a love nip if he gets worked up. Pixie is a loving boy who is protective of his people. He loves to follow you around and hang out in the same space. The one thing Pixie takes very seriously is meal time. He will look you in the eyes and knock things over if you don't feed this hungry boy. His previous home says he will love you and be your best companion if you give him the chance.

name: Ravioli
description_html:
Meet Ravioli, a lovely shepherd who is as scrumptious as his name! At first glance, his most striking feature is his wide, infectious smile, which he carries everywhere, an indicator of his sunny disposition and zest for life.

Ravioli is a fantastic companion for brisk walks and hanging around the house. He absolutely loves fetch and chasing balls, and is getting quite good at it! He‚Äôs also housetrained and respectful of his indoor space. He also loves splashing around in the kiddie pool and bringing his toys and balls with him into the water for extra fun.  

While he is a spirited and playful adventurer, Ravioli transforms into the ultimate cuddler once the day‚Äôs activities are done. He loves nothing more than to curl up close and share quiet time with his favorite person. He loves a back scratch and will cozy up right against you. Give Ravioli a squeaky toy, a long walk, and a good cuddle, and you‚Äôll receive unending joy in return!

name: Haiyan
description_html:
Meet Haiyan! üê∂üíô

Haiyan is an adorable deaf puppy with a heart full of love and a tail that never stops wagging! This playful little guy is dog-social, always up for a game of chase or a cuddle session with a furry friend. His joyful spirit and irresistible cuteness make him an instant favorite with everyone he meets.

Being in the shelter is tough for a puppy like Haiyan‚Äîhe‚Äôs ready for a cozy home, a warm bed, and someone to show him the ropes. Because he‚Äôs deaf, he‚Äôll need a bit of patience and guidance as he learns the world in his own way, but he‚Äôs already full of curiosity and happiness.

Haiyan would thrive in a home with another friendly dog to help show him the ropes, and a family who‚Äôs ready to love him just as he is. Could you be the soft place this sweet pup has been waiting for? üêæüíï

If you have any questions, please reach out to orangedotcrew@gmail.com to kickstart this heartwarming journey. For more delightful updates, follow Orange Dot Crew on Facebook and Instagram.

name: Buddy
description_html: Meet Buddy, a very respectful young (1.5 year old) boy now living with a 17lb doddle mix and a 40lb lab mix. Though he likes being around his dog companions he really enjoys being around kids playing outside. Game of fetch or just about any other game is ok with Buddy. Inside, he is calm and surrounds himself with as many squeak toys as possible. Though a young boy, he spends most of the day chilled with afternoons reserved for a long siesta. No problems with deer just outside the fence but the occasional squirrel will grab his attention. Though Buddy spends most of the day inside given the high outdoor temps, in the evening and early morning he enjoys being outside watching the world pass. The highlight of the day is his walk. His lease etiquette is being worked on but drastically improved over a short period of time (about 70% there). Buddy understands and obeys basic commands (stay, sit, laydown, off). If he does become excited inside, a simple command to laydown works every time. He is very respectful of the two other dogs living in the house even the little one who often try's to dominate. Too, it's amazing how little he sheds, especially compared to the other two we have but this could change throughout the year. Overall a very obedient calm boy who would love to have someone to play or spend time outside.

name: Gandalf
description_html:
Gandalf is very social, playful, cuddly, and is great with other cats/kittens.

Gandalf was brought to AAC with severe pelvic fractures that caused the pelvic canal diameter to decrease while healing. He is energetic and often gets the zoomies, but stool can back up and get stuck when trying to come out. He is on a once-a-day stool softener (a capsule that is super easy to give him, very inexpensive, and over-the counter), and is not having any issues with constipation. He will probably need to be on a softener the rest of his life.

The adoption fee is waived for Gandalf and ALL Desperate Housecats!

name: Capri
description_html:
Meet Capri ‚Äî the sweetheart waiting to steal your heart.

Capri walks right beside you on a loose leash like he‚Äôs always known you. He loves to munch on a toy while getting back scratches and will happily lean in for cuddles and neck rubs.

Playful and affectionate, Capri enjoys time in the yard as much as he likes snuggling with you on the couch.

With his adorable markings, gentle personality, and endless love to give, Capri is the perfect companion for someone looking for a loyal, snuggly friend.

name: Marvin
description_html:
Marvin is a great dog! Besides being a handsome fellow, he is very house trained, easy to walk on leash, friendly and playful. Marvin loves to romp around the play yard, chasing balls and tossing his toys. He is dog social and enjoys running along the fence line playing with other friendly dogs. Marvin is treat motivated, promptly sits on command and gently takes treats. He was also recently cat tested and passed with flying colors!


Marvin also has a softer side and is a quiet, affectionate young boy who enjoys cuddle time with his person. He will make a wonderful companion in a loving home.


Come meet sweet Marvin, and take home your new best friend!

name: Astro
description_html:
Say hello to Astro! 

Astro is your new best buddy who‚Äôs all about fun and games! This medium-sized superstar loves nothing more than chasing after toys and playing fetch like a champ. But don‚Äôt be fooled ‚Äî after he‚Äôs burned off his energy, Astro is a total cuddle bug who‚Äôs ready to snuggle up for some serious downtime.

He‚Äôs a dream come true for any dog parent ‚Äî super house-trained, easy to harness and leash up, and a breeze to walk. Whether you‚Äôre heading out for an adventure or just hanging out at home, Astro‚Äôs happy to be by your side.

Looking for a playful pal who‚Äôs also sweet and snuggly? Astro‚Äôs got your back (and your heart)!

name: Filo
description_html:
Meet Filo, a 4-year-old Boxer/Lab mix with the rare trifecta: he has lived successfully with big dogs, small dogs, a cat, and a toddler ‚Äî and was described by his previous family as friendly, playful, lovable, potty trained, crate trained, and easy to handle.

In the shelter, Filo shown the same great qualities:

  • Super housetrained
  • Great with toys (fetch is his love language ‚Äî he‚Äôll even drop the ball into your hand)
  • Soft, social play style with lots of dogs
  • Affectionate, cuddly, gentle once he knows you
  • Easy to leash, easy to walk, easy to re-kennel
  • Food-motivated and fun-motivated ‚Äî the perfect combo for training

Filo‚Äôs ideal home can be almost anything: a house with a yard, an active apartment, a family with kids, a multi-pet home, or a person who wants a playful buddy who also settles beautifully. He‚Äôs a ready-made companion with real-world experience and a big, soft heart.

Come meet Filo ‚Äî he‚Äôs the kind of dog who makes a home feel warmer the minute he walks in.

name: Scooby
description_html:
scooby arrived as a puppy and is still figuring out the whole ‚Äúbeing a dog‚Äù thing ‚Äî and it‚Äôs honestly adorable to watch. He‚Äôs curious, bright, and taking in the world one new experience at a time.

Even though he‚Äôs still learning the ropes, Scooby is quick, eager to please, and motivated to get it right. With some patience, consistency, and love, he‚Äôs going to grow into an incredible companion ‚Äî you can already see the potential shining through.

If you love the idea of shaping a young, smart pup and watching him blossom, Scooby is ready for his person to come cheer him on.

name: Pat
description_html: Pat is a sweet, shy puppy who needs to get away from the scary noises and into a home where he can learn about life safely and slowly. He likes cheese and booty scritches. He is paired with another dog.

name: Rabbit
description_html: Rabbit is a shy guy who loves the company of other cats! He especially enjoys playtime and cuddles with feline friends. He came in with several litter mates, but due to their overwhelming shyness, they have pretty much grown up at the shelter. He may need extra attention and guidance in a new home as he gradually settles in. Rabbit may do best in a home with a social cat to show him "how to cat" with humans and how to be brave. Meet this special guy today!

name: Micky
description_html: This gentle puppy is shy at first, but just takes a minute to open up and be his sweet, silly self. He's wiggly and happy. He's playful and adorable.

name: Mr. Shrimp
description_html:
Meet Mr. Shrimp üêæ

The Brave, Cuddly Companion You've Been Waiting For

Mr. Shrimp might have a silly name, but this young pup is all heart and courage. When he first arrived at the shelter, he was completely shut down ‚Äî scared, unsure, and desperate for comfort. He didn‚Äôt want anyone to leave his side, clinging to human connection as his anchor in a confusing world.

But oh, how far he‚Äôs come.

Thanks to patience, love, and his own incredible spirit, Mr. Shrimp's confidence has bloomed. He‚Äôs now a playful, affectionate, and curious companion who checks in often to make sure he‚Äôs being the very best boy. Whether it‚Äôs cuddling close, romping around with toys, or soaking up praise for his leash manners, he‚Äôs all about making you smile.

Mr. Shrimp is also impressively house trained and eager to learn the ropes of life outside the shelter. He‚Äôs the kind of dog who makes you feel special, just by choosing to trust you.

This brave little guy is ready for his next adventure ‚Äî could it be with you?

If you have any questions, please reach out to orangedotcrew@gmail.com to kickstart this heartwarming journey. For more delightful updates, follow Orange Dot Crew on Facebook and Instagram.

name: Tanya
description_html: Tanya may be shy at first, but we know there is a snuggler inside this girl! She's been easy to handle, even in her most timid moments. She enjoys romping around with her kennel mate and seems more relaxed with them around. The shelter can be very scary for some pets, so ideally we would love to see Tanya in foster if she isn't adopted soon!

name: Cabbage
description_html: Cabbage is a cuddly, playful baby who would prefer to be your only cat! He loves to play and would make a great companion for kids. This high energy boy is ready to escape the shelter forever!

name: Disco
description_html:
Per Disco's previous foster:

Disco is a sweet, smart & lovable 1.5 year old pup who can be energetic and playful yet mellow when just hanging out. He is crate & potty trained, and does very well just sitting on the porch or while we watch tv!

He's very well behaved, knows "sit", "down", "stay", & "place" (his crate & bed). He loves tug of war, hide & seek, and long morning & evening walks. Still a young pup, he needs long walks & play time to tire out his mind & body - we've been walking around 3-4 miles a day!

Although he does get very excited on walks & pulls a bit to sniff all the smells, & play with all the dogs (usually he can walk past with some peaked interest, but sometimes he does get real excited and itches to play with a very light whine and jump - were working on his focus & distractions with treats + positive reinforcement when he looks up at us or checks in) with some consistent training & socialization I'm certain he'd keep his attention at bay in no time! 

Despite his happy go lucky spirit, Disco also knows how to chill at home. He's easy to get in his crate, will sleep next to you for hours during a mellow day, and overall just loves laying down close to people.

He's just about 50lbs and shouldn't grow much more, so he's perfect to take in the car (his car manners are perfect) and on adventures!

Disco would be a wonderful fit for an active home willing to dedicate some time towards cuddles, tug-of-war, + a little bit of discipline & consistency!

name: Homer
description_html:
Bringing in a Homer

Homer arrived stray and a little depleted from his adventures. He's been in a foster home getting rested and recharged where he enjoys the company of his fosters and their dog. He's been a great house guest, house trained, loves his walks and loves catching a little play action whether wriggling in the grass on his back or with his canine friend.

He's reaching his goal weight and has been recently neutered. Now his heartworm status will be addressed and then he'll be ready for a new life ahead.

His care is currently sponsored by his advocates at ClassicCaninesATX.

Interested in learning more about adoption?

Reach out on his link to start a discussion with his fosters.

name: Kalamazoo
description_html:
Kalamazoo is ready to charm his way into your heart. His most distinguishing feature? Those absolutely iconic ears that give him a truly unique and lovable look!

More than just looks, Kalamazoo is a sweetheart through and through. This dog-experienced youngster loves to cuddle and is incredibly affectionate, soaking up every pet you can offer. He's a dream on walks‚Äîeasy on a leash‚Äîand housetrained. His favorite pastimes include splashing in a kiddie pool and playing, especially tug of war with a rope. If you're looking for a sweet, ready-to-love companion, Kalamazoo is available and waiting to be yours!

name: Prince Eric
description_html:
Prince Eric is a handsome, cuddly German Shepherd available to adopt or foster at Austin Animal Services. This cutie is basically a big puppy (but past the mouthy stage) and loves to be near his human. He‚Äôs also so easy on a leash! 

Prince Eric is just like the character from The Little Mermaid; he seems ready for adventure, is a total romantic, and has a kind and sensitive nature!

name: Bambino
description_html:
Meet Bambino! üêæ

This handsome 2-year-old boy is absolutely thriving in foster care and ready to find his forever home! Bambino is as sweet and affectionate as they come. He is truly a big baby who loves cuddles and playtime equally.

Bambino is a perfect house guest: quiet, well-mannered, and fully crate and house trained. He‚Äôs also a quick learner and a great listener!

Bambino adores his foster sister Koda, a playful 2.5-year-old pit mix and loves his toys. He‚Äôs friendly with new people and working on handling living downtown like a pro. He has been going on trail walks and is getting experience passing lots of other dogs in high-traffic situations living in a high-rise.

Bambino would thrive in a home either with or without another pet and fill your days with love, laughter, and loyalty. üíõ

name: Henrietta
description_html:
Henrietta is one of the most playful, joyful pups you‚Äôll ever meet. She loves a good snuggle on the couch or bed, and loves to chase tennis balls outside.


During her two months in foster care, she was housetrained, crate trained, polite to the many people she met (including kids!), and an excellent patio pup. She loves other dogs, especially if they can match her rowdy play style.

name: Bear
description_html:
Bear offers the best of both worlds! He is the definition of a snuggle bud. He's great on a leash and loves car rides (hello, hiking buddy!), but he's also perfectly content to relax at home. His calm, chill demeanor makes him an easy and wonderful companion.

Bear is highly food motivated, eager to please, and learns commands lightning-fast. Best of all, once he's comfortable, he‚Äôs a massive lovebug who insists on being your little small spoon for every snuggle session! Bear is crate trained and doing fantastic with his house training.

Instagram: @adopt_bestboybear.

What Bear Needs:

Bear is a star when he's out on walks‚Äîtotally non-reactive and composed around people! However, because he hasn't always been treated kindly, he needs slow, thoughtful introductions to new faces trying to pet him as he's still learning that not all new humans want to hurt him. We are actively working with a professional trainer, using positive reinforcement, to help him trade fearful memories for happy ones. Bear happily takes treats from people and can chill while you have a conversation.

Dog Friends: He's dog-friendly and would love to live with a confident dog(s) who can help boost his own bravery. He currently resides with 2 small dogs and 2 cats!

An Adult-Only, Cat-Free Home: Bear is not ready for kids rushing him and would most likely prefer a home without cats. However, he currently lives with cats in a small home and we feel in the right environment they could eventually coexist.

He is currently undergoing heartworm treatment, but his foster can provide all the details on his path to a full recovery! This treatment can be transferred to the adopter at no charge.

Follow Bear‚Äôs journey and get to know him better on Instagram: @adopt_bestboybear. You can also check out his brother Teddy who is up for adoption too!

name: Teddy
description_html:
Teddy is a handsome, 40-pound Catahoula mix with a striking dark brown patterned coat and warm amber eyes that will steal your heart. At under two years old, he‚Äôs the perfect blend of playful energy and calm affection.

This sweet boy loves to be wherever you are. He will curl up with you on the couch, hang out around the house, or join you on a walk. He enjoys running around the yard and plays wonderfully with his foster dog sibling. Teddy already knows how to sit and is working on lay/stay. He is eager to please (especially if treats are involved!).

Teddy‚Äôs favorite thing in the world is being close to his people. If you‚Äôre looking for a loyal companion who will shower you with love, follow you from room to room, and make every day brighter, Teddy is your guy!

name: Cleocatra
description_html: Cleocatra will mesmerize you with her golden eyes! She's affectionate and loves petting. She also gives excellent elevator butt. Cleocatra will show you her belly and it's not even a trick! She is so easy going and will make a loving companion cat to some lucky person.

name: Blue
description_html: Blue is having the time of his life in a foster home where he's proven to be a perfect size for his perfectly behaved life in an apartment - he's adapted so well with his smaller frame of about 50 lbs. He's quiet and stays home alone well. He's never destructive. He's easy to manage and easy to love. He loves everyone and passed a short cat test too. He's lived with a female dog sibling before and done very well. What are you waiting for? Your perfect match is right here... His friends at ClassicCaninesATX also have adoption support specials for the rest of 2025. Reach out on his link or write his advocates at caring@classiccanines.org

name: Marley
description_html: Marley is a high energy girl who loves spending time with people! She's friendly with everyone she meets at the shelter. She likes to bounce her way out of the kennel because she's so excited to leave it! Once outside this affectionate girl enjoys cuddles and play time. Marley is still coming to terms with having to be in a kennel. She doesn't like going back to it, and we can't blame her. She belongs in a home! We would love to see Marley in foster care if she isn't adopted soon.

name: Bubba
description_html:
Bubba may be a little shy, but once he gets to know you this buddy is a cuddle bug! He is a sweet sensitive boy who absolutely loves his friends.


He loves to romp around in the play yard and has recently learned how to go up and down the playscape ramps. He loves chasing after toys and zooming around. He also doesn't mind a dip in the kiddie pool either! In the real life rooms he will come lean against you for pets, then get up on the couch next to you for some cuddles (and maybe some zoomies). On leash Bubba is fantastic at walking and has zero prey drive, not even for a squirrel a foot away!


He is a gentle treat taker and knows sit really well.


Bubba may be a little slow to warm up but once he does he is one of the best buddies you could have!

name: Sadie
description_html:
Meet Sadie! This medium-sized sweetheart was found exhausted after having puppies and being on the run in Zilker Park. Now fully recovered, spayed, and up-to-date on all her medical care, this master-level cuddler is ready to find her forever home.

Sadie is incredibly smart, housetraioned, has learned "sit" and "stay" (mostly!), and hasn't met a single person she doesn't instantly adore. She's great with other dogs (a meet-and-greet is advised) and is a very easy passenger in the car. This pup loves to play, especially chasing balls, and is always ready for food and treats. She's working on enjoying walks; she much prefers the comfy life of a home, but is slowly making progress! Sadie would love a secure yard for her happy zoomies.

Ready to welcome this professional snuggler into your life?

name: Abner
description_html:
Abner is a handsome and sweet dog who is ready to steal your heart! This stunning boy has a truly unforgettable look, thanks to his striking eyes‚Äîone bright blue and one warm brown. His unique gaze perfectly matches his wonderful personality. 

On a walk, Abner is a dream, demonstrating excellent manners and staying easy on the leash. When it's time to play, he's energetic and engaging, but he settles down just as quickly for some quality snuggle time. Above all, Abner is affectionate and believes there is no problem a good, long belly rub can't solve. If you're looking for a playful, loving companion with an undeniably captivating look, Abner is the perfect match!

name: Coco
description_html: Coco is a lovable, medium-energy pup who enjoys walks, playtime, and snuggles. She‚Äôs housetrained, knows ‚Äòsit,‚Äô and is eager to find her forever home

name: Etta
description_html:
Etta & Bounce are shy kittens still learning how to be brave! Luckily, now they have some feline friends to help them along in the Cactus Cat room. Our Cactus Cats are shy/timid kitties that need some support building confidence, which they get through clicker training with volunteers.


Kittens like Etta & Bounce don't usually take long to blossom in the right home, but they may always be on the shy side or prefer hiding when they are scared.


They don't have to be adopted together, but may do best in a home with other social cats to model those behaviors for them.


I am a DHC, and I have my own webpage!


The adoption fee is waived for Etta and all Cactus Cats/Desperate Housecats!

name: Nova
description_html:
Nova was surrendered due to their owner's living arrangement changing. She's Smart, loyal, sweet, and playful. She's a very good girl for baths, too! Nova's favorite things are taking walks with her people, chasing balls, playing with squeaky toys, and enjoying a chew toy. Nova has lived with small and large dogs previously. She's awaiting her new home today!

From her foster parents:

Nova is an extremely sweet and curious dog who loves to be involved in every single conversation and is always eager to receive cuddles and praise. She loves eating kibbles and will drink lots of water when she's thirsty after long walks! She can be a little picky about her treats ‚Äì for instance, she does not love peanut butter treats so you may need to experiment. Nova is shockingly tolerating of baths, but she does not love getting her paws and eyes cleaned.

Nova loves running after balls but does not yet know how to retrieve them (maybe you can teach her!). She loves cars and car rides, and she is learning not to jump and lick when she is excited (to see you!). She may proudly carry your socks to you as a gift, and we still don't know why! She loves to sleep with you but can be trained not to if you don't want her on the bed. She is a little apprehensive of kids and may bark if they get too close. Nova is also protective of you and will bark at strangers in your home, but she becomes friendly when you tell her it's okay. She cares a lot about her people and will run over to help if you seem unwell.

Nova loves going on walks but is also very happy to stay home (where she naps and plays). She will run over and sit whenever she hears you pick up the leash! She is also really good at 'sit', especially if you have treats. She is super smart, so with lots of praises and treats, she can learn many more commands! She is very curious and will sniff most things unless it's a mop ‚Äì in which case she will hide behind you because she is scared of mops!

She loves following you around the house, but is not anxious to be by herself at home and responds very calmly to being in the crate. When we are outside, Nova makes sure that everyone is included, rushing home whenever someone is left behind! If she does not see you, she may also check every single car in the garage to make sure that you are not in there :)

name: Baby
description_html:
A super playful, goofy, and beautiful girl! Loves being with other cats so a home with a cat or multiple is preferred! She is quick to bond, cuddle, and play with cats and people. She doesn't have experience with dogs but it is possible that she could do well with a dog. She is also fully trained at using a litter box.

INDOOR ONLY! This is absolutely a requirement, as she was rescued from the outdoors at just 5 weeks old. She is completely domesticated and fully accustomed to the indoors now and cannot safely roam the outdoors by herself!

name: Chewbaca
description_html:
Chewbaca had quickly earned his spot as a dog volunteers love to take out. He has excellent leash manners, he matches your pace and follows your lead with ease. In the play yard he has some adorably sporadic zoomies and is always up for fetch.

He likes to meet new people gently, and once you‚Äôre friends he‚Äôs all about the cuddles. This sweet boy is house trained, calm, and oh so loving. He‚Äôs newer to the shelter so we‚Äôre still getting to know this easy going sweetheart. Between his pleasant demeanor and his unique looks we don‚Äôt anticipate him being with us long.

name: Hibi
