description_html: Hibi has been shy here but she enjoys pets and she approves of Churu as her snack of choice. That is a good way to make friends with her! She is affectionate but also appreciates her alone time. Hibi has not lived with other pets, so she may prefer (especially in her golden years) to be the only baby!

name: Henrietta
description_html:
Henrietta is one of the most playful, joyful pups you‚Äôll ever meet. She loves a good snuggle on the couch or bed, and loves to chase tennis balls outside.


During her two months in foster care, she was housetrained, crate trained, polite to the many people she met (including kids!), and an excellent patio pup. She loves other dogs, especially if they can match her rowdy play style.

name: Lily
description_html: Lily's foster says: "Lily is a very sweet senior and is friendly with people and dogs. She is fully housetrained and is also comfortable with an apartment."

name: Alakazam
description_html: Hocus, Pocus and Alakazam are timid kittens who started their journey outdoors and are still learning to trust humans. They will need a little time and patience to get used to a new home. They are all learning to be brave through clicker training! These students are excelling in their studies and will do "nose-boops" for Churu. They enjoy pets and won't startle if you go slowly. These kittens are looking for a quiet home with some slow, consistent efforts to help them build relationships and trust more easily.

name: Pocus
description_html: Hocus, Pocus and Alakazam are timid kittens who started their journey outdoors and are still learning to trust humans. They will need a little time and patience to get used to a new home. They are all learning to be brave through clicker training! These students are excelling in their studies and will do "nose-boops" for Churu. They enjoy pets and won't startle if you go slowly. These kittens are looking for a quiet home with some slow, consistent efforts to help them build relationships and trust more easily.

name: Snicker
description_html: Snicker is a curious, chatty purring machine! She loves to play and wrestle with her bonded sibling, Doodle. She likes to be wherever her person is and prefers to sleep curled up near her person and/or her brother. Snicker is a climber and would love her new home to have a nice, big cat tree!

name: Doodle
description_html: Doodle is a super snuggling, purring machine! He loves to play and wrestle with his bonded sibling, Snicker. He has a healthy appetite and is growing fast! He loves to be on a lap and prefers to sleep curled up with his person and/or his sister.

name: Apple Fritter
description_html:
Apple Fritter is the perfect mix of sweetness and smarts! This loving, cuddly boy adores being close to his people - whether it‚Äôs snuggling on the couch or leaning in for a hug. He‚Äôs a great listener and eager to please, making him a joy to have around.


Apple Fritter is both crate trained and house trained, so he‚Äôs already mastered his manners and is ready to fit right into your home. He loves attention but also knows how to relax quietly when it‚Äôs time to wind down.


If you‚Äôre looking for a loyal companion who will shower you with affection and make every day brighter, Apple Fritter is your guy!

name: Howie
description_html:
Howie is a sweet German Shepherd who is housetrained, very playful, and easygoing! He's had experience living with another dog at the shelter and going to playgroup, so he could do well with a dog-sibling after a meet & greet to make sure it's a good fit!

Howie sits quickly for treats or toys and loves to show how smart he is. He loves to splash in the kiddie pool, chase balls, and walks great on a leash! He would make a lovely addition to your family.

name: Evermore
description_html: Evermore is a very good boy who walks well on leash and will "sit" for a treat. He seems housetrained and is crate trained, as well. Evermore is affectionate with people and enjoys that quality time getting his walks at the shelter. We would love to see this boy in a home instead of a crate! Meet Evermore today!

name: Clara Bow
description_html:
Meet Clara Bow (aka Bowie)

Hi, I‚Äôm Clara Bow, but my friends call me Bowie - because I‚Äôm full of star power and a little bit of sparkle! I‚Äôm a young, happy girl (about 70 lbs) who loves people, other dogs, and pretty much everything about life. I bring sunshine wherever I go.


My Favorite Things

I‚Äôm house-trained, love walks, car rides, and playing with my dog friends. I get along great with both dogs and cats (yep, I‚Äôm that well-rounded). During the day, I like to explore, play with toys, or hang out with my foster brother. At night, I‚Äôll curl up next to you - I‚Äôm a world-class snuggler.


My Personality

I‚Äôve got that fun, goofy, young dog energy, so I‚Äôm looking for a family who is able to spend time with me to play. Whether it's with walks, yard time, adventures (bars, coffee shops pet stores, and playing tug-of-war, or another dog, I love living life and exploring. I‚Äôm working on my commands and doing great, but I‚Äôm young, curious, and sometimes a little ‚Äúmouthy‚Äù when I get excited (never aggressive - just young dog enthusiasm). A patient person that has experience with dogs would be great. I also think I'd be ok with a family that has older kids! I have experience with my foster mom's nieces and nephews who are really young, so that could work too but older kids will be better able to help train me :)


My Quirks (aka My Charms)

Like any dog who‚Äôs had to look out for herself, I really love food. Mealtime is the best part of my day, and sometimes I like to ‚Äúhelp‚Äù by checking if you‚Äôve dropped anything tasty when you're eating. I‚Äôve also been known to ‚Äúborrow‚Äù things around the house - socks, shoes, pens, you name it - just for fun and to see if they're edible. Everyone needs a hobby, right?


What I‚Äôm Looking For

I‚Äôd love a forever home with someone who:

  • Has experience with dogs is a must!
  • Can spend time playing with me
  • Ideally has another dog friend for me to romp around with
  • Preferably has a house with a yard or works from home if they're in an apartment. Someone who can dedicate the first couple of weeks to making sure I know you're coming back.*


*I was adopted once before for just a day, but was returned. I got really scared when I found myself alone in a brand new apartment and without my dog friend. I barked a lot because I didn‚Äôt understand what was happening. My adopter worked in an office four days a week and lived in an apartment, so they were worried about that. I don't do this with my current family who has a house and a cat/dog, but if adopted I just need someone patient who understands that adjusting takes me a little time, but once I feel at home I become confident.


If you‚Äôre looking for a loyal, funny, affectionate companion who‚Äôll make every day brighter, I might just be your Bowie!

name: Daisy
description_html: Daisy is an adventurous soul who loves going on walks and exploring her surroundings. She can pull on leash, but she's working on that. Practice makes perfect! Daisy may be a little nervous with initial greetings, but it doesn't take long to see her tail wag and her body relax. She's ready to bust out of here and get on with her new life in a real home!

name: Canela
description_html: Canela has such a wonderful personality and is such a sweet girl. She‚Äôs playful and loves fetch with her stuffies (she‚Äôs pretty good at dropping them for you to toss too!). She also loves playing in the little puppy pools, and splashing around in them. She‚Äôs also very house trained! Once she works out her zoomies, she‚Äôs super easy on a leash. She‚Äôs a super cuddly young pup, and loves to lean against her human for pets and scratches.

name: Candy Corn
description_html:
Candy Corn is not your average dog! This handsome boy stands out with his incredibly unique eyes and coat‚Äîa striking brindle pattern set against an orange hue, earning him his sweet and tasty name.

He is a delightful companion who brings joy wherever he goes with his infectious smile.. Candy Corn is very housetrained and leash-trained, making him a breeze to live with. As a true Lab, he adores food and treats (which makes further training fun!).

He‚Äôs ready for fun with his favorite activity being fetch, which he‚Äôll happily play until you tire out. Candy Corn is a playful, loving, and unique pup ready to shower his forever family with affection!

name: Anya
description_html:
Meet Anya! Our resident pretty little potato princess. This little girl loooves to be pampered - food, treats, play, pets, cuddles, you name it!

 

Anya is very sweet-tempered and easy to handle. She's a very independent kitten who will happily play on her own, but don't let that fool you - she loves being pet and snuggling with her foster mom at night. She's a bit timid and skittish in new situations but will always come out for a treat or toy. Once she gets comfortable, she'll happily spend the day scampering around (she seems to bounce more often than walk...) in between cozy naps in choice locations.

 

Anya is curious and playful around her foster mom's two cats while always respecting their boundaries. When they tell her no, she's happy to give them their space and play on her own. Given her easy-going and gentle nature, she could also be a good fit for households with children who have the patience to gain her trust, as she doesn't mind being picked up or touched anywhere and, when needed, is very vocal about her needs or dislikes.

name: Chocolate
description_html:
Chocolate is a shy, sweet, and handsome boy who loves his people! He is an easygoing pup who is good on a leash, housetrained, and looking for someone to help build his confidence. He‚Äôll reward you with his loyalty and affection.  

Chocolate could fit into many different lifestyles and living environments, so come meet him and see if he's right for you!

name: Ocean
description_html: Ocean‚Äôs foster says: "Ocean is an absolute sweetheart. She loves to cuddle and play and is also very relaxed. If you are busy she will keep herself entertained for hours with a toy or napping. She is crate and house trained. She loves kids and other dogs.‚Äù

name: Milo
description_html: Milo is a super cuddly cat. He loves head and neck scratches and is super super playful. He will play fight with you but loves being near you when he naps. He is pretty food motivated and will come running if he hears food. If you put your face close to him, he will reach up to bump you with his nose! He loves sleeping on desks and harder surfaces (mattress instead of pillows). He is very playful with his sister Cinder (16177) and gets the zoomies all the time! He loves humans and is indifferent about other cats. If you are home often and can give him the attention he needs, he would be an amazing kitty for you!

name: Cinder
description_html: Cinder may be small, but she has a lot of personality! She loves playing with her brother Milo (16181) and following him around. She is cuddly and will sit on your chest, hip, anywhere, to be near you! She's a bit shy at first and will take a second to warm up, but once she does, she is super sweet! She would do best in a family with another cat or kitten as she loves being around them. She doesn't like playful pats and likes relaxing with you more and playing with other cats instead. She's the runt so she is quite small, but very very cute!

name: Deecee
description_html:
Meet DeeCee!

DeeCee is a sweet and playful girl who came to the shelter when she wasn‚Äôt getting along with one of the dogs in her previous home. She‚Äôs full of love and personality ‚Äî always ready to play ball, go for walks, or enjoy a good cuddle session, especially before bedtime!

This smart pup already knows several commands like ‚Äúsit‚Äù and ‚Äústay‚Äù, and she‚Äôs eager to please. According to her previous owner, DeeCee is good with cats and children, making her a wonderful fit for many families.

If you‚Äôre looking for an affectionate, loyal companion who will bring joy and energy into your life, come meet DeeCee today!

name: Lola
description_html:
Lola is an absolute angel, with ears as big as her heart! She was found at a homeless encampment, looking for love, and still on her search today.


She is potty trained, crate trained, walks great on a leash, is non-reactive on walks/in general, and loves everyone she meets. Lola is an expert cuddler, and although it seems she has not had any prior formal training, she is incredibly smart and food motivated (AKA the perfect training combo!) She is also the perfect passenger (backseat) princess on car rides, and is just building up the courage to jump in the car by herself. She would love a yard for sunbathing, but is currently doing great in an apartment and will go stand by the door to let you know she wants to get her steps in, or work on her tan! As a younger dog, she loves and needs her long walks and play time, however, she has great inside manners and mostly naps while indoors.


She is currently the only dog, in a child-free home, but her gentle, friendly, and tolerant personality leads me to believe that she has the potential to live with young human and animal companions‚Äî After a meet and greet of course!


Lola is an amazing dog that has shockingly been overlooked in the shelter, but her time in foster has revealed so many amazing qualities! If you are interested in Lola, or want to hear more about her infinite list of adorable quirks and positive traits, please reach out for more information!

name: Ribbon
description_html:
This sweet calico cat is a gentle soul wrapped in a patchwork of soft orange, black, and white fur. Naturally shy, she tends to observe the world from a quiet corner at first, her curious eyes taking everything in before she makes her move. But once she feels safe, her loving personality shines through‚Äîshe‚Äôll greet you with soft purrs, gentle head bumps, and a quiet presence that brings calm to any room. She‚Äôs the kind of companion who wants to know what you are doing and likes to be around.


I have a little friend! See the video. My friend is 16256

name: Tinsel
description_html: This little kitten is shy to warm up, but warm up quickly she will. She is extremely playful and fearful of dogs.

name: Cooper
description_html: This little guy is on the shy side and would probably blossom best in a quiet home where he can get lots of consistent positive interactions!

name: Bunny
description_html:
Bunny is a gentle, easy-going pup with a sweet, soulful personality. She‚Äôs fully house-trained and crate-trained, and settles beautifully once she knows she‚Äôs in a safe, loving home. Bunny enjoys a good game of fetch, daily walks, and any chance to explore‚Äîbut she‚Äôs just as happy to curl up and relax with her people.

She has coexisted peacefully with our resident dog and is non-reactive to others on walks. Bunny can be a little shy with new dog friends during playtime, so a patient, respectful canine companion (or being the only dog) would be a great fit. She does have a higher prey drive and gets excited by squirrels, but she redirects well with a little guidance.

Bunny is bright, curious, and eager to learn. She knows her basics and has picked up new commands quickly in foster care. With her gentle nature and sweet demeanor, Bunny is ready to be someone‚Äôs loyal companion and bestest friend.

If you‚Äôre looking for a loving, well-mannered pup who brings joy into the home, Bunny might be your perfect match!

name: Dokie
description_html:
Our charmer here is Dokie and he arrived weather worn and will appreciate a cozy place to stay while his body and soul catches up. He's very easy going and quite charming, gentle on a walk and overall an easy going friend to people and to dogs. We feel he'll get along well with most dogs that don't try to bulldoze him over.

Dokie is a great choice for those who want to help a good dog get back to his very best.

His eyes are receiving treatment and he has some other needs to be checked over.

Come meet this sweetheart today. He's advocated for by his friends at Classic Canines ATX - Questions? If on site, reach out to staff. If offsite, reach out to his advocates caring@classiccanines.org

name: Peregrine
description_html: Peregrine came in as a scaredy kitten, but she's grown into a shy but curious girl while she's been here. She enjoys pets and will stretch out and purr and might grab a bite to eat while you're petting her. Peregrine may still need a slow introduction to a new home (like most cats), but we don't think it will take long for her to settle in. Adopt this special girl today!

name: Sushi
description_html:
Move over Pizza and step back Hamburger‚ÄîMr Sushi has entered the chat! I‚Äôm a polka dot prince who‚Äôs got a lot to say. Mostly filing official complaints about how you aren‚Äôt playing with or petting me. 


I adore attention from my humans and may give you a nip to get it‚Äîso I‚Äôll be best in a house with no kids. I have lived with a dog before and our energies didn‚Äôt align, but my foster parents think I may do well with another energetic cat to play with!


So if you are in the market for a lovable and loyal boy and wanna boop my perfect black nose for a lifetime, get your application in!

name: Mojo
description_html:
Meet Mojo ‚Äî the ultimate cuddle bug with a heart of gold

Mojo‚Äôs love languages are absolutely physical touch and quality time. He‚Äôll accept gifts if you insist, but what he truly wants is to be as close to his human as possible. From the moment you meet him, his gentle, affectionate nature shines. This boy is all about closeness, connection, and soaking up every bit of love he can get.


Mojo is a dream on leash, checks in often with his walker, and already knows cues like sit and shake. He‚Äôs polite, well-mannered, and radiates ‚ÄúI want to be your best friend‚Äù energy. He also keeps his kennel impressively tidy, suggesting he may be house trained. Passing people and dogs? No problem for this calm, steady guy‚Äîhe simply minds his manners and keeps moving.


If you‚Äôre looking for an affectionate, easygoing companion who loves deeply and loyally, Mojo is your match. Come see why everyone falls for this handsome lovebug.

name: Lady G
description_html: Lady G is a beautiful big girl who is very housetrained and always happy for a kennel break. She is easy to leash and strolls along nicely checking out the surroundings. Lady G shows curious interest in other dogs and exhibits the typical hound dog vocal traits. She is a sweet, gentle young dog and a mellow companion who is ready for her forever home. Come meet her!

name: Mesquite
description_html: Mesquite is a shy baby boy who seems to like the company of other cats. If you go slowly, you can make friends with him, too! The shelter can be a scary place, so we understand that this boy just needs a quiet and calm space to relax. He's an affectionate boy stuck in a scaredy cat body for now! Help Mesquite grow into a confident boy through adoption or foster today!

Meet Your New Best Friend! üêæ

This handsome boy is as sweet and loyal as they come! He‚Äôs already potty trained and leash trained, making him super easy to walk and hang out with. He loves people and has a calm, affectionate personality ‚Äî the kind of dog who‚Äôs happiest just being by your side.

He‚Äôs currently getting neutered and started on heartworm prevention, so he‚Äôll be healthy and ready for his forever home soon.

Right now, he does show some aggression toward other dogs, but we‚Äôre hopeful that will improve after his neuter and once he settles into a loving home. He‚Äôs very gentle and well-behaved with people, and with a little patience and structure, he‚Äôs going to make an amazing companion.

If you‚Äôre looking for a loyal, sweet, and easygoing dog to share your days with, this guy is the perfect match. ‚ù§Ô∏è

name: Buttermilk
description_html: Buttermilk may give you a sour expression, but that's just her face! She's an affectionate girl, all purrs and loves to make biscuits. Buttermilk was an abandoned community cat, so she's used to the kindness of strangers. Now she would appreciate the kindness of a real home! This affectionate girl deserves it.

name: Tot
description_html: Tot is such a sweet girl, and she loves to love. She is always cuddling up and wants to be held. Tot has such a silly personality and is very curious. She is very playful and loves to play with her brother Tater. They are not an official bonded pair, so they do not need to be adopted together, but if you are interested in adopting both Tater and Tot, please let me know!

name: Tater
description_html: Tater is such a good boy and just want to play and have fun. When he gets tired, he loved to snuggle up. He loves his food and snacks. He is very loving and friendly and has a very silly personality. He loves playing with his sister Tot. They are not an official bonded pair, and they do not need to be adopted together, but if you are interested in adopting both Tater and Tot, please let me know!

name: Veruca Fiona Apple Salt
description_html: Veruca Fiona Apple Salt may have four names, but she is one sweet kitty! I've been fostering her for about a month now, and she has been a real delight. Very well-behaved, easygoing, and the BEST sleeper. She's also good with newcomers and has made fast friends with any guests I've had over. She is content to hang out with her people and stick close, but doesn't require constant attention. Veruca would be happiest as the only child. She is ready to explore her new home today!

name: Jett
description_html: Jett is a little kitten with a special situation! He has had tremors at the shelter, which means he may shake at times. This could be a birth defect, which would be a lifelong condition, or something he will grow out of. We are not sure what is causing it, but are treating him to cover any possible infections that could be taking place. His adopter should take him to the vet for an initial exam. He's full of love and is ready to light up some lucky person's life.

name: Yule
description_html: Like all good kitties, Yule is very social, playful, and cuddly (he loves sleeping with his foster mom at night). He is great with other cats/kittens, and wouldn't mind being adopted into a home where he has a cat buddy to hang with.

name: Luanne
description_html:
Luanne is the gentle soul of the group ‚Äî shy, sensitive, and incredibly sweet once she feels safe. She, too, began with fear and trembling, but now she chooses to stay in the room with her human, watching with big trusting eyes. She‚Äôs still skittish with touch and needs slow movement and soft voices, but she‚Äôs highly food-motivated and making steady progress. With time, kindness, and patience, she‚Äôll bloom into the tender, loving companion she‚Äôs meant to be. A delicate little angel just waiting for her moment to shine.


Want to know more about Luanne? My foster mom has an instagram where she posts pictures and videos of me! You can DM her to ask questions too! : @jamiethekittenfoster_atx

name: Peggy
description_html:
Peggy came in acting like a tiny tornado of fear, but once she realized she was safe, her confidence exploded. Now she marches around like the queen of the household, chirping for attention and following her human everywhere. She loves big belly rubs, has a purr that sounds like she‚Äôs bragging, and proudly declares herself your No. 1 assistant. Peggy is bold, brilliant, and completely convinced she‚Äôs doing everything exactly right ‚Äî and honestly, she usually is.


Want to know more about Peggy? My foster mom has an instagram where she posts pictures and videos of me! You can DM her to ask questions too! : @jamiethekittenfoster_atx

name: Hank
description_html:
Hank started out as the tough, silent type ‚Äî all hisses, shakes, and ‚Äúrespect my personal space.‚Äù But beneath that stoic exterior is a thoughtful boy who watches everything with careful eyes. These days, Hank likes being near his people, lounging in the same room and quietly observing. He‚Äôs still cautious, and pets require a slow, gentle approach, but he‚Äôs wonderfully food-motivated and clearly wants to trust. With patience and a calm home, Hank will blossom into the steady, loyal companion he‚Äôs meant to be. A true gentleman in training.


Want to know more about Hank? My foster mom has an instagram where she posts pictures and videos of me! You can DM her to ask questions too! : @jamiethekittenfoster_atx

name: Penny
description_html:
Meet Penny ‚Äî a brindle sweetheart with great manners!

She‚Äôs easy to leash and kennel, house trained, treat motivated, walks well on leash, knows her commands, and loves sniffy, playful outings. Penny enjoys treats, praise, and pets once she settles in. Sweet, smart, and ready to shine! Come meet the total package! üíñüê∂

name: Macho
description_html:
Macho is a very easygoing and gentle German Shepherd who loves to show off his tricks. He knows ‚Äúsit,‚Äù ‚Äúshake,‚Äù and ‚Äúdown!‚Äù He is very easy to walk on a leash and loves to be close to his humans for cuddles and pets. He‚Äôs one of the sweetest dogs around and would be perfect for anyone looking for a laid-back shepherd.  

He's recently been paired with another dog and could do well with a dog sibling after a meet-and-greet!

name: Matilda
description_html: Matilda is a friendly, easy going tabby girl who came in as a stray. She enjoys pets and will take every opportunity to have a snack! She came from an area with lots of cats and seems relaxed around them in the shelter, so she may do well in a home with cat friends. Matilda is ready for a life with a little more luxury today!

name: Arlo
description_html:
Meet Arlo ‚Äî a bright-eyed, bold-hearted tabby ready for his next adventure!



Arlo is a handsome brown-and-gray tabby with a big personality to match his striking looks. Playful and independent, he‚Äôs always the first to pounce into a game, explore a new corner, or start a friendly wrestling match with his brother Ralph.


This confident little explorer loves meeting new people and animals. He‚Äôs been well-socialized with children, dogs, and adult cats, so he‚Äôll settle easily into just about any loving home. Arlo brings joy, energy, and a whole lot of charm wherever he goes.


If you‚Äôre looking for a fun-loving, social kitten with tons of heart, Arlo is your guy ‚Äî ready to make your home his favorite place to play, purr, and grow.

name: Ralph
description_html:
Meet Ralph ‚Äî the sweetest little gray-and-white cuddlebug you‚Äôll ever meet!


Ralph is the snuggle champion of his litter, happiest when he‚Äôs curled up on your lap, tucked under your arm, or being gently held. He‚Äôs wonderfully social and curious, but he also has a calm, thoughtful side that makes him the perfect companion for quiet mornings, cozy evenings, and everything in between.

Ralph has been lovingly socialized with children, dogs, and adult cats, so he‚Äôll fit beautifully into a variety of homes. He brings an easy warmth wherever he goes, and his gentle, affectionate nature shines through in every interaction.


Whether adopted solo or with one of his playful siblings, Ralph is ready to fill your home with comfort, sweetness, and purrs.


This little guy will melt your heart every single day.

name: Penny
description_html:
Penny, aka Pretty Penny, was born to love and be loved. She has two modes: Tornado on four legs and couch potato ‚Äî there is no in between!


This 8-month-old, 45-lb German Shepherd mix is a delightful blend of playful, goofy, and sweetly clingy. She‚Äôs clumsy in the most endearing way, loves climbing right into your lap (despite being far too big for it), has zero concept of personal space and will definitely stare at you like you‚Äôre her favorite person in the world. Personal space? Never heard of it. Whether she‚Äôs doing zoomies across the yard or melting into the couch, Penny‚Äôs favorite place is wherever you are.


Penny is very food-motivated ‚Äî and while her attention span might rival that of a gnat (or a chicken nugget üçó), she‚Äôs smart and eager to please. She‚Äôs what we like to call a ‚Äúpay-me-first‚Äù type of employee. She knows sit, look at me, paw, and lay down, but she expects to see the goods (aka treats) before performing her tricks. The good news? She‚Äôs starting to respond to commands without a treat in sight ‚Äî progress, people!


She‚Äôs still learning her strength when it comes to jumping up and gentle mouthing during play, so continued guidance will help her polish those puppy manners. She‚Äôs house-trained and crate-trained, has never had an accident indoors, and sleeps soundly through the night. She may whine a bit when you leave or head upstairs (she‚Äôs just making sure you remember how much she loves you), but she‚Äôs improving as she gains confidence and trust.


She‚Äôs shown interest in other dogs and has been friendly with neighborhood pups, though she can get a bit too excited during greetings. Penny would thrive in a home where she gets plenty of attention, consistent training, and space to zoom around.


She‚Äôs a medium-energy girl who needs time to play, but she‚Äôs just as happy to curl up beside you for hours. She does have a jealous streak ‚Äî after all, she believes she‚Äôs the star of the household ‚Äî and her bark is as big as her personality, so a family who can appreciate her ‚Äúbig voice‚Äù will fit her best.

If you‚Äôre looking for a loyal, silly, endlessly loving companion who will keep you laughing and your heart full, Pretty Penny might just be your perfect match. üíõ


She's currently not a big fan of car rides and can only tolerate about 20-minute drives (she gets car sick) but we're hoping she'll be able to work through that as time goes on.


Adoption requirements:

üíõ Room to play (and zoom)

üíõ Tolerance for dramatic barking

üíõ Love for goofy dogs who give 110% in everything they do

name: Twilight
description_html: Twilight is beautiful - the most photogenic on campus. He is playful, energetic, smart, and ready for an adventurous life.

name: Big Mac
description_html: Big Mac is a shy but affectionate boy who loves other cats! Once he gets to know you, he will open up and have long conversations with you about life, love, whatever the topic is he's down. At the shelter he immediately bonded with another cat in his room and seems comforted by him. He is shy with first greetings, but warms up with a little time and will purr and roll around when petted. Big Mac is ready for his new home today!

name: Pumpkin
description_html:
Meet Pumpkin!

Pumpkin is a delightful mix of sassy and cuddly! She loves zooming around and playing with her siblings, then hopping over for snuggles once she's ready for a break. The most adventurous of her litter, Pumpkin is curious and loves exploring every corner of the house.

Playtime is her favorite - she'll chase or pounce on just about anything! After she's had her fun, she settles in for cozy cuddles and a long nap. Pumpkin has met dogs but hasn't spent much time with them yet, and she could potentially thrive in a home with other cats and dogs.

name: Lady Pablo
description_html:
Meet Lady Pablo

She's been recently paired with a couple of sweet makeover agents, her foster parents, who along with the sponsored care she receives from her friends at ClassicCaninesATX, are restoring her body and spirit. She had been left behind in the washroom of an apartment building, heavily matted into a large fur ball. We don't believe she was ever left outdoors. Someone taught this sweet baby love, they simply did not have the ability to care for her.

She's spayed and heartworm negative. Her weight is perfect. Her matts have been shaved off and for the first time in years she is walking on her real paws, she can feel wind on her skin, her body is capable of full stretches, she can run and fully "feel" again. With that comes time to adjust to her new body and touch, requiring understanding, patience and light management by her VIPs. She loves love and has a spirit that will warm your soul, but can be subject to occasional startles--her body is new to her..

Lady Pablo seems to be very content near cats.

She's had limited engagement with dogs and seems to mostly co-exist, although we think she would prefer to have all of the people attention for herself.

Her ideal person or people will have some experience with small dogs that need a little extra help and guidance in life, It's her turn to catch up for all the years she's lost out on.

Interested in learning more?

Click on her link to reach her foster parents.

name: Sprinkles
description_html: Sprinkles is a super sweet, outgoing, and snuggly kitten. She will walk right up and starting talking to you before immediately settling down into your lap and purring up a storm at the first opportunity. As you can see from her photos, Sprinkles is a beautiful little baby with a soft tortie coat with one distinctive white whisker. She has also done great in a home with other cats. Sprinkles completed her spay surgery on 10/29 so she is ready to head to her forever home any day now! Her sweet tuxedo sister, Dazzle (17022), is also available for adoption and AAC waives the adoption fee for a second kitten.

name: Dazzle
description_html: Dazzle is a curious, playful, and sweet little kitten. She has beautiful green eyes and adorable white socks on each of her feet along with a white belly. Dazzle can be a teeny bit shy at first, but once she warms up, which took less than a day in foster care, she is a total snugglebug who wants to be in your lap purring up a storm whenever she is sleepy. She has also done great in a home with other cats. Dazzle is quite the adventurer and likes climbing up high and playing with just about any toy. She completed her spay surgery on 10/29 so she is ready to head to her forever home any day now! Her sweet tortie sister, Sprinkles (17021), is also available for adoption and AAC waives the adoption fee for a second kitten.second

name: Tinsel Toes
description_html:
‚ú®Meet Tinsel Toes!‚ú®

Tinsel Toes is a sweet, gentle bunny who loves companionship and would make a wonderful addition to any home. She‚Äôs litter trained, easy to care for, and enjoys relaxing near her person once she feels comfortable.

She‚Äôs a big fan of her daily greens, especially parsley and cilantro, and will happily hop over when it‚Äôs snack time. Tinsel Toes is ready for her forever home and will thrive with someone who can give her love, patience, and a cozy indoor space to explore.

If you‚Äôre looking for a calm, affectionate rabbit to bond with, Tinsel Toes might be your perfect match!

name: Hugo
description_html: Hugo is a playful, fun guy who is ready to be the life of the party! He loves outings with his human friends, and especially enjoys a game of chase with tennis balls. He has a lot of energy, but also doesn't forgo the snuggles. He listens well, has good manners and is housetrained. Hugo is ready for his home!

name: Goldie
description_html: Beautiful Goldie was brought to the shelter as a stray with a fractured pelvis. She spent much of her early puppyhood recovering on crate rest. But she is now on the mend and thriving in foster! Goldie is a lovely Belgian Shepherd mix and a sweet little goofball and will grow up to be an elegant, long-legged blonde! She can be a little shy meeting new peeps, but warms up quickly. She recently a busy adoption event full of new people, dogs, sights and sounds and Goldie was a perfect little lady and behaved beautifully. She is about 99% potty trained and she's a natural at walking on a loose leash! She loves to play with other dogs and wears out her two big canine foster brothers running around the yard. She has been around a cat and wanted to run after it. But she's still a puppy and can adapt to living with cats. This sweet little lady would make a stellar family dog and a great active buddy for anyone looking for a pup that is equal parts energetic adventurer and snugglebug!

name: Falcor
description_html:
Falcor is a big, gorgeous boy who was surrendered to AAC with a urethral obstruction. The blockage ultimately cleared but later re-occurred, requiring that he undergo perineal urethrostomy surgery (this surgery removes the narrow part of the urethra, intended to prevent additional blockages).


Falcor completed his recovery in foster care, and is now ready for his permanent home. While his recovery has gone smoothly, his new family needs to provide him with a prescription diet to prevent and minimize future bladder inflammation. His current wet food favorites are Purina Pro Plan Savory UR Selects Salmon and Hills Prescription Diet Urinary Care with Ocean Fish. For dry food, he likes Hills CD and Royal Canin Urinary SO.


Falcor is incredibly patient, gentle, and sweet! He will do best in a household as an only pet or where his access to food is separate from other pets. He would do GREAT as a family pet because he is so gentle and loving.


See Falcor on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/falcor_blue?igsh=N3M4dHBjOWN1ejdz


I am a DHC, and I have my own webpage!


The adoption fee is waived for Falcor and all Desperate Housecats!

name: Angel
description_html:
~ Meet Angel

Let's give a very warm welcome to dogs like Angel, 11 yrs of wisdom, who are coping with being in a shelter. Then let's resolve to make their stays short, with this stop being simply a short passage way to a new life, a new tomorrow. Angel's owner went into hospice, and this is why she is here. She seemed a bit sad, out of place, unsure if she were safe, all of those things we are used to seeing, unfortunately. Getting to kick up her heels in the play yard and try hard to hide her new toy treasures (lol-not very well) was a welcome outlet for her. She loves everyone and we think she would be a great fit with kids too. See her short video to see how she's coping with daily life. Is Angel the lady that captures your heart that you would like to lift up and make a difference for? She's on a short outing but needs to stay out of the shelter-ready to help her?


All Adopters of dogs 7 yrs and up receive a $150 veterinary care credit, a $100 Chewy eGift card and adoption fees are waived - ready to make a difference? Reach out to caring@classiccanines.org

name: Sawyer
description_html:
Sawyer is a magnificent 4-year-old Mastiff with a heart as big as he is! Although Sawyer is a very big boy, he is the definition of a gentle giant. Don't let his size fool you‚Äîthis boy is an absolute cuddlebug who thrives on affection and loves nothing more than leaning in for some quality snuggle time.

Sawyer has an incredibly playful spirit and is always up for a good time. He's also housetrained and a dream to walk, exhibiting good manners while out on his leash. Ready to add a loyal, loving, and slightly oversized goofball to your family? Sawyer is waiting to fill your home with cuddles and joy!

name: Pumpkin
description_html: Pumpki is the typical orange cat. Playful, a little crazy but loves his humans passionately. Ready to go home to his family Dec 3rd.

name: Finley
description_html: Finley is a cuddly, affectionate boy who has lived with other cats and small dogs. In a home, this guy loves to run around and play with his toys. Sometimes play time can get a little too exciting and Finley may give a little nip due to overstimulation. So, he would benefit from an adopter who understands this behavior and can help guide him. Finley is over kennel life and would much rather spend the rest of his days in a home!

name: Peaches
description_html: Peaches came to us as a stray so we don't know about her history, but we can tell this resilient girl has overcome some challenges just to get here! She may look a little rough on the outside but she's a marshmallow cuddlebug on the inside. Peaches is gentle and affectionate, and she'll do anything for a treat. She's in need of some TLC and extra snacks to get her where she deserves to be. She loves people and does well on leash (though it may still be a learning process). We are looking for a loving foster home to get her out of the shelter if she isn't adopted soon!

name: Meatloaf
description_html: Meatloaf may be all muscle on the outside, but inside he's just waiting for an opportunity for cuddles and play time. He's a goofy guy who loves to go on walks, but still learning those leash skills. (Meatloaf has yet to look in the mirror and realize how thick his own neck is.) He loves treats and will easily sit for them. He immediately becomes a happy boy when he gets to go on a walk and hang out with people. Meatloaf would probably LOVE a yard to hang out in. He's a nature lover. But, he's also an excellent, calm boy when crated. It doesn't take much to please this guy. Meatloaf is ready to go home today!

name: Luna
description_html: Luna absolutely loves company! She wants to hang out with her human and feline friends as much as possible. Companionship is very important, and this girl knows it. She was brought to the shelter when her previous owners felt they could no longer meet her needs. Luna is shy but affectionate and may enjoy a home with a cat to be her friend. She also loves to play with toys! Luna is ready to meet new friends today!

name: Spruce
description_html: Spruce is a goofy, playful bunny rabbit. He likes balls and stuffies and bouncing around with a human. He is outgoing, fearless and ready for adventures. He has been paired with other dogs.

name: Aurora
description_html: Aurora started out extremely shy in the shelter, but she's becoming a happy, wiggly girl. She's an affectionate girl with people, but the loud noises of the shelter and all the dogs around her still sometimes can be overwhelming. We could see this timid lady blossoming in a quiet home where she can get into a consistent routine and get lots of encouragement for every act of bravery. She relaxes outside on walks and enjoys snuggling up against her friends. Ask our team about foster or adoption for this special girl.

Meet this sweet little boy who just needs a bit of time to feel safe. He can be shy with new people at first, but he absolutely blossoms around other cats and loves their company. Once he trusts you, he melts right into your hands, and if you cuddle him, he‚Äôll reward you with the cutest little snores.

He‚Äôs a quiet, tidy kitten who keeps himself clean and rarely meows. If you‚Äôre looking for a gentle companion who‚Äôll bond deeply once he warms up, he might be your perfect match.

name: Hans
description_html:
Handsome Hans was brought to AAC very thin and dehydrated. Despite how he felt, he was extremely loving and social.

Now living in foster care, Hans has gained weight and made a complete recovery. All he needs now is a permanent home, with or without other cats, where he can sit in your lap, get 3 squares a day, and give/receive tons of affection.

The adoption fee is waived for Hans and ALL Desperate Housecats!

name: Starlight
description_html: Starlight is waiting for her inner self to come shining through! But this is hard for a shy kitty to do in the shelter. She could use some extra encouragement to help her feel brave, and the true key to achieving this is getting into the right home. Starlight loves cuddles and gets comfort from slow, gentle interactions with people. She may also enjoy the company of feline friends. Starlight has a sparkle inside that she's waiting for someone to discover and appreciate!

name: Figgy Puddin'
description_html: Figgy Puddin is an absolute charmer! He's easy for walks and loves to get his wiggles out in a play yard. Figgy has a gentle curiosity for other dogs and people that he sees on his outings. Once play time is over, he's happy to just hang out and watch the world while getting cuddles from his friends. This affectionate and easy going guy is the perfect catch!

name: Purrcilla
description_html: Peppermint Patty may growl or hiss at first, but that's just a habit she picked up as a kitten living outdoors and on the streets! She was rescued by one of our animal protection officers when her caregiver noticed she had an injury to her tail that didn't heal. She was just a little thing when she first arrived, but has since grown and matured into a very proper, gorgeous lady! Our Veterinary team performed a partial tail amputation when she received her spay surgery, so she is ready to go home today! She wasn't sure she loved being around humans until after she had fully recovered from her surgery and then her true personality was unleashed! She would love a lap/shoulder to cuddle on all day long! She is still a young lady, so will also enjoy lots of play! This sweet little thing is waiting for you!

name: Bentley
description_html:
Very well-mannered and calm

Very well trained - knows many tricks!

Medium energy (but low energy for a Shepherd!)

Walks loosely on leash with no pulling or reactivity to big dogs or small animals (birds,squirrels)

Does not jump

If you want a GOOD dog that will fit right into your home, this is your guy!

name: Lady
description_html:
If you are looking for a sweet, easy going cuddle

bug then Lady is your girl! She would love nothing more than to cuddle up on the couch to watch tv and relax with you ‚ù§Ô∏è

name: November
description_html:
November is a very sweet boy, with a huge, instant purr and he loves attention. He‚Äôs easy going, loves attention all the time‚Ä¶ if he‚Äôs not playing with his sibs. He‚Äôs low+ energy so far, maybe a little more as he grows. Use the email below to reach out to his foster directly for more information or to set up a meet/greet. [More Pictures Coming Soon.]

- Email: adaywithfosters@gmail.com

- Pictures & Info: https://www.instagram.com/adaywithfosters

 

November is the biggest of all his five siblings and loves to wrestle when he plays. From people, he loves pets of any kind, head scratches, belly rubs and laps. He might even chirp for attention. Like all his siblings, he‚Äôll purr before you even pick him up and you can hear him and all of them from across the room. He‚Äôs decent about being carried around too. He‚Äôs often keenly aware of where you are and watches, ready for attention and sometimes hard to get a picture as he gets up to greet you. He‚Äôs often close by to help you find toys under the couch, look in cabinets as he‚Äôs nosey and loves to explore as does all of them.

 

During the day, he zooms and plays interchangeably with his sibs and love to wrestle and a couple of his smaller sisters tell him what for but they don‚Äôt run. He also loves to play with toys of any kind- string, mice and fast toys like ping-pong balls, rattle mice and loves springs, as do they all. He‚Äôs social and doesn‚Äôt shy away from new people and relaxes quickly in your lap. He gently hand wrestles when you play with him even for his size, as he nibbles on your fingers. Once he learned about a lap, he‚Äôll peep at your feet to be picked up but he hasn‚Äôt jumped up yet. He often sleeps close by, under my chair or under my desk on a blanket near my feet‚Ä¶ or he naps/sleeps interchangeably with his sibs. During the day, he sleeps on the sofa with them or high up on the cat tree.

 

He has a small, soft voice and doesn‚Äôt talk much‚Ä¶ though he might chirp to say hello when you come close to pet him‚Ä¶ so, he might talk more as he grows. He does speak up when it‚Äôs meal time, telling you he‚Äôs ready. He climbs a tall sisal cat tree well to nap with his sibs as well and scratches a rope tree very well. Like all his sibs, he loves playing in the bathtub. At night, he‚Äôll cuddle up with his siblings on the bed but doesn‚Äôt cuddle up more than that‚Ä¶ and he‚Äôs usually gone by dawn. I think he would do fine as a solo kitten for someone who works from home, as he loves attention. He would do very well with any of his siblings- Ash 17076, Cormac 17077, Pumpkin 17078, Wish 17080 or Maple 17081. November is polite and not pushy, and think he would also do very well with a cat‚Ä¶ warming up to them, a kitten, even a dog who would like a playmate.

 

He‚Äôs pretty good with the litter box. He‚Äôs pretty good getting his front nails clipped when he‚Äôs sleepy. He warms up pretty quickly with new people too and doesn‚Äôt shy away. I think he‚Äôll do fine with children once used to their energy. He‚Äôs fine w/ my older cat and he‚Äôs polite to her, sniffing, etc. I think he would do OK with a dog too once he gets used to them after slow introductions.

name: Ash
description_html:
Ash is a very sweet boy, with an instant, huge purr and he loves attention. He‚Äôs easy going, loves attention first, last and most everywhere in between if he‚Äôs not playing with his sibs. He‚Äôs low+ energy so far, maybe a little more as he grows. Use the email below to reach out to his foster directly for more information or to set up a meet/greet. [More Pictures Coming Soon.]

 

- Email: adaywithfosters@gmail.com

- Pictures & Info: https://www.instagram.com/adaywithfosters

 

Ash is middle sized of his five siblings. He enjoys pets, head scratches, belly rubs and he‚Äôll serpentine between your legs for attention. Like all his siblings, he‚Äôll often purr before you even pick him up and he stays in your arms a little longer each time as he and his sibs are learning about being carried about. He‚Äôll politely ask to be put down when he‚Äôs ready‚Ä¶ and may follow you around‚Ä¶ unless he has to run off and play with his sibs. He‚Äôs often keenly aware of where you are and watches, ready for attention and sometimes hard to get a picture as he gets up to greet you. He‚Äôs often close by to help you find toys under the couch, look in cabinets and even close to help watch you clean litter boxes.

 

During the day, he zooms and plays interchangeably with his sibs. He also loves to play with toys of any kind- string, and fast toys like ping-pong balls, rattle mice and springs! He‚Äôs social and doesn‚Äôt shy away from new people but he‚Äôs still maturing and learning to enjoy attention and to relax in a lap. He gently hand wrestles when you play with him, rub his belly, as he nibbles on your fingers or he often licks your fingers. So far, he hasn‚Äôt asked for a lap but will chirp at your feet to be picked up. He often crashes near-by, under my chair or under my desk on a blanket near my feet‚Ä¶ or he naps/sleeps interchangeably with his sibs. During the day, he sleeps on the sofa with them or high up on the cat tree.

 

He‚Äôs a little soft spoken when you talk to him or he wants your attention when you get close‚Ä¶ so, he might talk more as he grows. He does speak up when it‚Äôs meal time, telling you he‚Äôs ready. He climbs a tall sisal cat tree well to nap with his sibs as well and scratches a rope tree very well. At night, he‚Äôs often first up on the bed, wanting attention while I read. He likes to be close by but so far doesn‚Äôt cuddle up‚Ä¶ and they‚Äôre all off playing by dawn. I think he would do fine as a solo kitten for someone who works from home, as he loves attention. He would do very well with any of his siblings- Cormac 17077, Pumpkin 17078, November 17079, Wish 17080 or Maple 17081. Ash is polite and not pushy, and think he would also do very well with a cat‚Ä¶ warming up to them, a kitten, even a dog who would like a playmate.

 

He‚Äôs very good with the litter box and often business. He‚Äôs also very good at getting his front nails clipped when he‚Äôs a little snoozy as he enjoys the closeness. He warms up pretty quickly with new people too and doesn‚Äôt shy away. I think he‚Äôll do fine with children once used to their energy. He‚Äôs fine w/ my older cat and he‚Äôs polite to her sniffing, etc. I think he would do OK with a dog too once he gets used to them after slow introductions.

name: Cormac
description_html:
Cormac is a very sweet boy, with a huge, instant purr and he loves attention. He‚Äôs easy going, loves attention all the time‚Ä¶ if he‚Äôs not playing with his sibs. He‚Äôs low+ energy so far, maybe a little more as he grows. Use the email below to reach out to his foster directly for more information or to set up a meet/greet. [More Pictures Coming Soon.]

 

- Email: adaywithfosters@gmail.com

- Pictures & Info: https://www.instagram.com/adaywithfosters

 

Cormac is slightly smaller than his brothers, of five siblings. He loves head scratches, belly rubs and he‚Äôll serpentine between your legs and will chirp for attention. Like all his siblings, he‚Äôll often purr before you even pick him up and he‚Äôs pretty good about being carried around. He‚Äôll politely ask to be put down when he‚Äôs ready‚Ä¶ and may follow you around‚Ä¶ unless he has to run off and play with his sibs. He‚Äôs often keenly aware of where you are and watches, ready for attention and sometimes hard to get a picture as he gets up to greet you. He‚Äôs often close by to help you find toys under the couch, look in cabinets and even close to help watch you clean litter boxes.

 

During the day, he zooms and plays interchangeably with his sibs. He also loves to play with toys of any kind- string, and fast toys like ping-pong balls, rattle mice and loves springs. He‚Äôs social and doesn‚Äôt shy away from new people and relaxes quickly in your lap. He gently hand wrestles when you play with him, rub his belly, as he nibbles on your fingers and he‚Äôs a little bit of a licker as most of his sibs are. Once he learned about a lap, he would chirp at your feet to be picked up or just climb your jeans leg. He often sleeps close by, under my chair or under my desk on a blanket near my feet‚Ä¶ or he naps/sleeps interchangeably with his sibs. During the day, he sleeps on the sofa with them or high up on the cat tree. He‚Äôs a good climber and a budding explorer, higher shelves as he can jump higher and into any cabinet or closet as soon as you open the door. 

 

He has a soft voice and is a little chatty and will talk to you for pets or when you talk to him‚Ä¶ so, he might talk more as he grows. He does speak up when it‚Äôs meal time, telling you he‚Äôs ready. He climbs a tall sisal cat tree well to nap with his sibs as well and scratches a rope tree very well. Like all his sibs, he loves the bathtub even after a shower and it‚Äôs soaking wet. At night, he‚Äôs often first up on the bed, wanting close while I read but he doesn‚Äôt cuddle up yet. Often most are off and gone by dawn but sometimes Cormac will still be on the bed at dawn. I think he would do fine as a solo kitten for someone who works from home, as he loves attention. He would do very well with any of his siblings- Ash 17076, Pumpkin 17078, November 17079, Wish 17080 or Maple 17081. Cormac is polite and not pushy, and think he would also do very well with a cat‚Ä¶ warming up to them, a kitten, even a dog who would like a playmate.

 

He‚Äôs very good with the litter box and often covers his business. He‚Äôs so-so getting his front nails clipped and might tell you what for so I get them when he‚Äôs snoozy. He warms up pretty quickly with new people too and doesn‚Äôt shy away. I think he‚Äôll do fine with children once used to their energy. He‚Äôs fine w/ my older cat and he‚Äôs polite to her, sniffing, etc. I think he would do OK with a dog too once he gets used to them after slow introductions.

name: Pumpkin
description_html:
Pumpkin is a very sweet boy, with a huge, instant purr and he loves attention. He‚Äôs easy going, loves attention any and all the time‚Ä¶ even if he‚Äôs playing with his sibs. He‚Äôs low+ energy so far, maybe a little more as he grows. Use the email below to reach out to his foster directly for more information or to set up a meet/greet.


- Email: adaywithfosters@gmail.com

- Pictures & Info: https://www.instagram.com/adaywithfosters

 

Pumpkin is a decent sized boy of his five siblings. He loves pets of any kind, head scratches, belly rubs and he‚Äôll serpentine between your legs and will chirp or say pet me for attention. Like all his siblings, he‚Äôll purr before you even pick him up and he‚Äôs pretty good about being carried around‚Ä¶ and he‚Äôll follow you around‚Ä¶ unless he has to run off and play with his sibs. He‚Äôs often keenly aware of where you are and watches, ready for attention and sometimes hard to get a picture as he gets up to greet you. He‚Äôs often close by to help you find toys under the couch, look in cabinets and even close to help watch you clean litter boxes.

 

During the day, he zooms and plays interchangeably with his sibs. He also loves to play with toys of any kind- mice, string, and fast toys like ping-pong balls, rattle mice and loves springs, enough to carry them around to keep them away from his sibs. He‚Äôs social and doesn‚Äôt shy away from new people and relaxes quickly in your lap. He gently hand wrestles when you play with him, rub his belly, as he nibbles on your fingers and he‚Äôs a licker on your hand or arm. Once he learned about a lap, he‚Äôll chirp at your feet to be picked up but he hasn‚Äôt jumped up yet. He often sleeps close by, under my chair or under my desk on a blanket near my feet‚Ä¶ or he naps/sleeps interchangeably with his sibs. During the day, he sleeps on the sofa with them or high up on the cat tree.

 

He has a medium sized voice and can be a little chatty. He‚Äôll talk to you for pets, even if you get close by or when you talk to him‚Ä¶ so, he might talk more as he grows. He does speak up when it‚Äôs meal time, telling you he‚Äôs ready. He climbs a tall sisal cat tree well to nap with his sibs as well and scratches a rope tree very well. Like all his sibs, he loves playing in the bathtub. At night, once up on the bed, he‚Äôll cuddle up close, up against my shoulder while I read, wanting close. Often most are off and gone by dawn but sometimes Pumpkin will still be on the bed at dawn. I think he would do fine as a solo kitten for someone who works from home, as he loves attention. He would do very well with any of his siblings- Ash 17076, Cormac 17077, November 17079, Wish 17080 or Maple 17081. Pumpkin is polite and think he would also do very well with a cat or kitten who would like a playmate, even a dog who would like a companion.


He‚Äôs pretty good with the litter box and hoping he gets better as he grows up. He‚Äôs pretty good getting his front nails clipped when he‚Äôs sleepy. He warms up pretty quickly with new people too and doesn‚Äôt shy away. I think he‚Äôll do fine with children once used to their energy. He‚Äôs fine w/ my older cat and he‚Äôs polite to her, sniffing, etc. I think he would do OK with a dog too once he gets used to them after slow introductions.

name: Melo
description_html: Melo is a big cuddle bug! He's loving, patient and will give you hugs. His favorite things (besides snuggling with his people) might be playing catch and going on outdoor adventures. He loves his walks! Melo also has good experience getting along with other dogs and seems to enjoy their company. He's a crate trained all around very good boy ready for a home that matches his winning personality!

name: Maple
description_html:
Maple a very sweet girl, with a giant, instant purr and she loves attention any time and all the time‚Ä¶ save when she‚Äôs playing with her sibs. She‚Äôs easy going, loves attention and purrs big long before you pick her up. She‚Äôs low+ energy so far, maybe a little more as she grows. Use the email below to reach out to her foster directly for more information or to set up a meet/greet. [More Pictures Coming Soon.]

 

- Email: adaywithfosters@gmail.com

- Pictures & Info: https://www.instagram.com/adaywithfosters

 

Maple was always the fluffiest of her litter and early on she was the littlest but now is a chonk of a girl, which matches her big purr. Like all her siblings, she‚Äôll purr big and I can get her to purr by just talking to her as I walk over‚Ä¶ and her purr is loud even from across the room. She‚Äôs not shy like her sister Wish but very up front and forward for attention but she hasn‚Äôt asked for a lap yet and just asks to be picked up and put in your lap.

 

During the day, she zooms and plays interchangeably with her sibs and zooms very well. She also loves to play with toys of any kind- string, mice and fast toys like ping-pong balls, rattle mice and loves springs. When she was little, she wasn‚Äôt a fan of wrestling with her big brothers but now she holds her own and zooms and wrestles with all her sibs. Once in your lap, she hand-wrestles gently and we play belly tickle often. She‚Äôll walk up for attention but so far hasn‚Äôt asked for a lap but will sit still for entire head rubs. She often sleeps close by, under my chair or under my desk on a blanket near my feet‚Ä¶ or she naps/sleeps interchangeably with her sibs. During the day, she sleeps on the sofa with them or high up on the cat tree.

 

She has a small, soft voice and can be slightly chatty at times or she might chirp to say hello when you come close to pet her or talk to her‚Ä¶ so, she might talk more as she grows. She does speak up a little when it‚Äôs meal time, telling you she‚Äôs ready. She climbs a tall sisal cat tree well to nap with her sibs as well and scratches a rope tree very well. Like all her sibs, she loves playing in the tub. At night, she‚Äôll cuddle up with her siblings on the bed for a kitten pile and on occasion will come up to cuddle but not a big cuddle like her brother Pumpkin. I think she would do fine as a solo kitten for someone who works from home as she wouldn‚Äôt mind getting all your attention. She would do very well with any of her siblings- Ash 17076, Cormac 17077, Pumpkin 17078, November 17079 or Wish 17080. Maple is gentle and polite and think she would also do very well with a cat or kitten who wants a playmate, even a gentle dog for a companion.

 

She‚Äôs very good with the litter box and covers pretty well. She‚Äôs pretty good getting her front nails clipped when she‚Äôs snoozy. She warms up well to new people too with toys and string. I think she‚Äôll do fine with children once used to their energy. She‚Äôs fine w/ my older cat and she‚Äôs polite to her, sniffing, etc. I think she would do OK with a dog too after slow introductions.

name: Wish
description_html:
Wish a very sweet girl, with a huge, instant purr and she loves attention after she gets over a little shyness. She‚Äôs easy going, loves attention and purrs big after a second or two. She‚Äôs low+ energy so far, maybe a little more as she grows. Use the email below to reach out to her foster directly for more information or to set up a meet/greet. [More Pictures Coming Soon]


- Email: adaywithfosters@gmail.com

- Pictures & Info: https://www.instagram.com/adaywithfosters

 

Wish is a decent sized girl of his litter. If you move slow, she loves pets of any kind, belly rubs and we‚Äôre working on laps and she sometimes chirp for attention when you‚Äôre close. Like all her siblings, she‚Äôll purr big and I can get her to purr by just talking to her as I walk over‚Ä¶ and her purr is loud. Since she‚Äôs my shy girl, she‚Äôs learning to trust and working on carrying her around. She‚Äôll need a patient person to help her continue to learn to trust and open up. Like her sibs, she loves to explore and play.

 

During the day, she zooms and plays interchangeably with her sibs and zooms well. She also loves to play with toys of any kind- string, mice and fast toys like ping-pong balls, rattle mice and loves springs. She‚Äôs come a very long way since I first took her in and he‚Äôs become far more social and I think she‚Äôll open up more with help. Once in your lap, she hand-wrestles gently and we play belly tickle often. She hasn‚Äôt asked for a lap yet but won‚Äôt run if you reach for her slowly for a lap. She often sleeps close by, under my chair or under my desk on a blanket near my feet‚Ä¶ or she naps/sleeps interchangeably with her sibs. During the day, she sleeps on the sofa with them or high up on the cat tree.

 

She has a small, soft voice and doesn‚Äôt talk much‚Ä¶ though she might chirp to say hello when you come close to pet her or talk to her‚Ä¶ so, she might talk more as she grows. She does speak up a little when it‚Äôs meal time, telling you she‚Äôs ready. She climbs a tall sisal cat tree well to nap with her sibs as well and scratches a rope tree very well. Like all her sibs, she loves playing in the tub. At night, she‚Äôll cuddle up with her siblings on the bed but doesn‚Äôt cuddle up more than that‚Ä¶ and she‚Äôs usually gone by dawn as they play. I think she would do fine as a solo kitten for someone who works from home to give her a safe place. She would do very well with any of her siblings- Ash 17076, Cormac 17077, Pumpkin 17078, November 17079 or Maple 17081. Wish is gentle and polite and think she would also do very well with a easy going cat or kitten who wants a playmate, even a gentle dog for a companion.

 

She‚Äôs very good with the litter box and covers well. She‚Äôs pretty good getting her front nails clipped when she‚Äôs sleepy. It takes her a little bit to warm to new people too with toys and string. I think she‚Äôll do fine with children once used to their energy. She‚Äôs fine w/ my older cat and she‚Äôs polite to her, sniffing, etc. I think she would do OK with a dog too after slow introductions.

name: K‚Äôjay
description_html: K'Jay had to be surrendered due to their owner's health issues. This big boy is a cuddler who loves praise! Tell him what a good boy he is and he will be happy the whole day about it. This friendly boy will gladly sit in your lap or lean in to be closer to you. He's still working on his leash manners and doesn't always realize his own size or strength but he responds well to gentle coaxing. K'Jay is a young, smart guy who is eager to please and loves learning!

name: Bellanova
description_html:
To say that Bellanova doesn‚Äôt like other pets is a bit of an understatement. She REALLY doesn‚Äôt like them.

Bellanova suffers from anxiety, and does best when on medication (she was previously on gabapentin, and it worked very well for her). Her previous owner loved her dearly, but could no longer take care of her, so they brought her to AAC. We would LOVE to get her into a real home, either through adoption or through foster (she does best with women).

Her owner told us that Bellanova is playful, talkative, independent, and high energy. She will give hard love bites when she‚Äôs overstimulated. Due to her anxiety, she is afraid of almost everything, and when she is startled, she is likely to attack. As long as she is on medication, she is well-behaved.

Bellanova must go to a home with no other pets and a very cat-savvy adopter.  

I am a DHC, and I have my own webpage!

The adoption fee is waived for Bellanova and all Desperate Housecats!

name: Rudolph
description_html:
Meet Rudolph!

This sweet, floppy-eared pup is as cute as his name suggests. Rudolph is a young, energetic bundle of joy who loves nothing more than playtime and cuddles. Whether he's chasing after a tennis ball or curling up beside you for snuggles, he does everything with a big, happy heart.

Rudolph is a fetch champion in the making and absolutely lights up when he sees a toy. He‚Äôs also a dream on walks‚Äîno pulling, no zig-zagging‚Äîjust a gentle little trot from a very good boy who loves exploring the world by your side.

Playful, affectionate, and endlessly cheerful, Rudolph is ready to bring joy to a lucky family. If you‚Äôre looking for a sweet companion who‚Äôll keep you smiling and your heart full, come meet this happy fella today! üêæüíõ


email blueplusbusters@gmail.com for more info!

name: Habibi
description_html:
This sweet, snuggly pup is ready to steal your heart! He loves nothing more than curling up for head rubs and soaking in all the affection he can get. When it‚Äôs playtime, he‚Äôs a fetch superstar‚Äîhe‚Äôll chase the ball with enthusiasm and proudly drop it right at your feet for another round!


He does great with other playful dogs and enjoys having buddies to romp around with. On walks, he‚Äôs a dream‚Äîeasy on the leash and happy to explore by your side. He would thrive in a home with a yard or anywhere he can stretch his legs, play fetch, and run around.


Habibi is so ready for his forever family. Could it be yours? Come meet him today!

name: Gumdrop
description_html: Gumdrop is all wiggles and zoomies! He's a young guy who loves to run around in the play yard and get all that energy out. He seems housetrained and listens to direction. He's working on his leash skills (he doesn't seem to know his own strength). This handsome boy is ready for his freedom from kennel life!

name: Mira
description_html:
Mira and Dove are shy girls who came into the shelter as young stray kittens. They seem to rely on each other and love each other, so they may do well in a home together. These girls enjoys treats and pets, you just have to go slowly and give them some time to open up. They are still learning that the shelter doesn't have to be a scary place, but we think they will truly blossom once they are in a quiet home. Mira and Dove are members of our Cactus Cat program for shy cats who need a little encouragement.


The fee is waived for these special girls and all Cactus Cats.

name: Edmond
description_html:
Sweet Edmond has had a rough start to life. He was found living on the streets with two other dogs, doing his best to survive day by day. When his little group was rescued, Edmond was understandably overwhelmed by all the changes. After the female dog he was closest to was taken to the shelter, he completely shut down in his finder‚Äôs home ‚Äî his world had suddenly become a much lonelier place.


Despite his fear, Edmond has a gentle soul. He‚Äôs not ready to seek out affection yet, but he watches the world with soft, hopeful eyes ‚Äî you can tell he wants to trust.

Edmond will need a very patient, understanding foster or adopter who can give him time to feel safe again.


A calm home, possibly another friendly and confident dog, and someone who can offer stability and kindness will help him blossom at his own pace.


If you have the heart to help a scared dog learn that the world can be kind, Edmond is waiting for you.

name: Kobe
description_html: Kobe is a handsome and easygoing German Shepherd. He is easy to walk on a leash, loves to chase balls, affectionate, cuddly, and all-around very good boy!

name: Yoda
description_html: Yoda is a sweet girl who loves to cuddle and play all day! She loves to sleep right next to your head at night with her littermates and she greets you by sitting on your shoes. She would do best in a household with another cat to keep her entertained!

name: Greyson
description_html: Dusty & Greyson came to the shelter when their owner could no longer care for them. Dusty is outgoing and friendly, while Greyson is shy and timid with new people. Both boys are affectionate and enjoy pets. Greyson may take a little more time getting used to a new place than his more confident brother, Dusty. These boys are bonded and should be adopted together.

name: Dusty
description_html: Dusty & Greyson came to the shelter when their owner could no longer care for them. Dusty is outgoing and friendly, while Greyson is shy and timid with new people. Both boys are affectionate and enjoy pets. Greyson may take a little more time getting used to a new place than his more confident brother, Dusty. These boys are bonded and should be adopted together.

name: Reggie
description_html: Reggie may be a bit shy in the shelter, but we can't blame him. It's a crazy place sometimes and this low-key guy would probably prefer a quieter space to relax. He's very affectionate and can even be playful once he is outside with his friends. There's a lot to love about this gentle boy. Reggie is content to be close to his people and get belly rubs while you tell him what a good boy he is. We expect him to truly blossom in a home and become the brave boy he was meant to be!

She has has always been the most outgoing of her siblings, she would like to make friends with everyone she meets. She loves playing with her siblings, and would love to take a nap in your lap when she's done playing! She will make little chirrups to let you know where she is!

He is a very active kitten who spends most of his time wrestling with his siblings! He loves to carry his toys around in his mouth! When he's run out of energy, he would love to take a snooze on your lap!
While she's the smallest of her litter, she can hold her own in the kitten wrestling matches! She loves playing, but even more, would love to become your lap cat! She is very sweet and cuddly!
He is a very sweet, talkative kitten who loves wrestling with his siblings and cuddling with you!

name: Samuel
description_html: Samuel is a very brave young man who was rescued from the streets with his sibling when he was just a little one! He is quite courageous to have survived living outside when so young and tiny! He may prefer changes come slowly with plenty of time for him to adjust and adapt, but once he does, he is very sweet and loves cuddles and pets! He will likely get along with other calm kitties and doggies if introduced slowly. Samuel is resilient and strong and has his whole life ahead of him to love you and be your very best friend!

name: Quinn
description_html: Quinn came to the shelter due to housing restrictions. He's a shy, quiet boy who is happy to just be included in the company of his people. Quinn can be cuddly without being demanding. He's content to hang out with his family and know that he's loved. One thing he doesn't enjoy is being hungry, so keep this baby boy well fed and he'll love you forever. He has lived with other cats and dogs, so may do well in a multi-pet home.

name: Cillian
description_html: Cillian came into the shelter due to housing restrictions. He's shy, quiet and may prefer to hide when he's feeling insecure. Cillian was a very independent cat in his previous home. He's low-maintenance and there may be times you don't even know he's there! But, Cillian will choose his moments for snuggles and he does enjoy pets. His one weakness might be shoelaces. He loves to chew them, so put your shoes away and get this guy a proper wand toy! He's lived with other cats and dogs so may do well in a multi-pet home.

name: Olive
description_html: Olive is a friendly girl who loves pets and the company of people. She seems fine around other cats in the shelter. This outgoing girl was being cared for in the community, but could no longer stay with her caregiver. She would probably enjoy a window for watching the world or a catio or other safe outdoor situation. Olive is ready to explore a home and get all the love and attention she deserves!

name: Timmy
description_html: Timmy is a tiny shepherd dreamboat. He is adorable and sweet. He looks right at you, sticks to your side, and asks for hugs. He is laid back for such a young little pup. He is paired with a dog friend and should be snapped up quick. He's perfect.

name: Meaty Manz
description_html:
Looking for a sweetheart who will melt your heart the moment you meet him? Meaty Manz is your guy! As soon as you step into his kennel, this lovable little meatball will climb right into your lap and rest his head there, soaking up all the affection he can get.


He‚Äôs easy to harness and a dream on leash‚Äîwalking with perfect loose-leash manners and showing no fuss around other dogs. For Meaty Manz, the simple joy of being out of his kennel is enough. Along the way, he‚Äôll happily pause for cuddle breaks, which are his absolute favorite.


This gentle, affectionate pup is the kind of dog who wins hearts instantly. One meet-and-greet with Meaty Manz and you‚Äôll understand‚Äîhe‚Äôs the sweetest companion you could ask for, ready to bring love and snuggles into his forever home.


Meaty Manz would love:


A family who enjoys cuddle sessions as much as he does

Daily walks where he can show off his perfect leash skills

A calm, loving home where he can thrive

Meaty Manz is ready to steal your heart and be your best friend for life. Come meet him today!

name: Toby
description_html:
Toby arrived at the shelter as a stray, and the shelter environment has been very overwhelming for him.


Toby has lost about 5 pounds since arriving because of shelter stress.

Even though he‚Äôs frightened, he has been nothing but gentle and calm with staff and volunteers.


We know he‚Äôll blossom once he has a peaceful space to decompress.

If you can offer Toby a safe, soothing place to heal, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

name: Sully
description_html:
Sully was found as a stray near the HEB by William cannon and I-35. Not much is known about his life before this moment, but he has made quite the impression in the short time we have had him. From the moment we set eye on him he was a happy gentleman, sitting calmly outside HEB. He accepted food gently, and belly rubs with great enthusiasm. Since that moment Sully has proven to be a mild mannered, medium to low energy dog, who is grateful to be inside and willing to accept any love shown to him. He has met many people, tons of dogs and one sassy cat, and each time he is polite, calm and friendly. He gently wrestles with our high energy dog, but ultimately loves to flop over on his back during play and just wiggle on the ground. He does not resource guard but he is food motivated for training, and he walks well on leash. He doesn‚Äôt bark inside and will generally only bark outside if left alone, he for the most part just wants his human close by. He is willing to cuddle, but could easily be trained to stay off furniture as for the most part he just lays on the floor or his dog bed. Again he is calm with cats!! He shows mild interest in our cat but responds well to being redirected or even disciplined by the cat.i would recommend a slow introduction to be safe, but he is very gentle and just a giant lovable oaf. He has also played well and been friendly with every dog he has been introduced to. As a large unfixed male, this was something we were worried about initially, but as with everything else he has exceeded our expectations. And he will be fixed soon, so that will likely calm him even more.




Sully could do well in any environment but I believe his perfect home would be him with a kind family that maybe has a pet or two for him to be friends with. He would love a home where people are around and spending time with him or bringing him out on lots of walks. He deserves to be around people and loved and spoiled every day. Sully would not do well in a home where he is kept outside or as more of an outdoor dog, as he is a prince and deserves to be treated as such.




He is about 2 years old, in good health but heart worm positive. He is fully house trained, good with dogs and cats, children unknown but I have a strong sense he would be as gentle with them as every other person he has met. He is medium to low energy, but likes to play, and is opening up more everyday. So far he doesn‚Äôt jump or lick and has very good manners meeting new people. He is a great dog who deserves a very loving family

name: Riley
description_html:
Meet Riley


He spreads a lot of happiness and cheer with his people pleasing personality.

He's a Australian Cattle Dog of a perfect size and weight, and just the right speed to be a great walking friend, enjoying the sniffs and adventures of all your outdoor excursions.


Welcoming to people and friendly toward his nearby dog neighbors, Riley may be blind in his right eye but it doesn't affect him much. It may be congenital. He's otherwise healthy and appears to have been an indoors dog. If you love the personality of a smart and friendly cattle dog who's not "over the top", not ball obsessed, but just the perfect speed, Riley needs to be on your short list. He's advocated for by his friends at caring@classiccanines.org - ask staff to meet him or email with questions.

name: Willow
description_html: Willow is a beautiful, young, sweet Catahoula Leopard dog. She‚Äôs such an easy leash walker, and checks in with her human by looking back with those gorgeous blue eyes on walks. She‚Äôs treat motivated and is great at responding to commands like ‚Äúsit‚Äù on a walk if you want to get her attention for a treat. She‚Äôs also super loving and cuddly. She‚Äôs curious about all things around her, quietly watching birds in a tree, listening to leaves rustling, and watching squirrels running around. She‚Äôs a wonderful combination of playful and sweet and would make such an amazing companion to her human.

name: Priscilla
description_html:
Priscilla may be a little shy at first, but she warms up quickly‚Äîespecially if you have treats! Once she‚Äôs comfortable, she turns into the snuggliest, cuddliest, kissiest girl you‚Äôve ever met. She‚Äôs incredibly gentle, with no mouthing or nipping, just pure sweetness.


When playtime arrives, she loves chasing toys around the yard and zooming happily after anything that bounces. She also walks beautifully on leash and enjoys exploring the world by your side.


Priscilla is ready to find her forever family‚Äîone that will give her the love and patience she deserves. Could that be you?

Come meet her and fall in love!

name: Teddy
description_html: Teddy and Liam came in together and love each other very much, so they should be adopted together. These boys arrived at the shelter when their owner was no longer physically able to care for them. Teddy is a cuddly lap cat who loves to play with toys. He's talkative and has no problem sharing his feelings with you. Liam is quiet, shy and more on the independent side, but he also enjoys play time. Liam is a calm soul who is content to hang out near his people and enjoy their company. These boys have been through a lot of change, so they may take a little time adapting to new situations. Give Teddy and Liam a chance today!

name: Liam
description_html: Teddy and Liam came in together and love each other very much, so they should be adopted together. These boys arrived at the shelter when their owner was no longer physically able to care for them. Teddy is a cuddly lap cat who loves to play with toys. He's talkative and has no problem sharing his feelings with you. Liam is quiet, shy and more on the independent side, but he also enjoys play time. Liam is a calm soul who is content to hang out near his people and enjoy their company. These boys have been through a lot of change, so they may take a little time adapting to new situations. Give Teddy and Liam a chance today!

name: SQUISH
description_html:
Squish (nubby) is a very curious and affectionate kitty!

He loves to play and enjoys smaller dogs around his size.

He‚Äôs got a little nub as a tail but that doesn‚Äôt stop him from living his best life. He‚Äôs looking for his forever home!

name: Paloma
description_html: Paloma is shy for a few seconds, then opens right up for pets. She was brought in as a stray, but she was definitely someone's pet at some point. This girl loves affection and seems comforted by it. The shelter can be a stressful place for an adult cat, so we'd love to see this girl in a home ASAP either through foster or adoption.

name: Luna
description_html: Gentle and shy sweet girl
